1466630.title: DevOps Systems Engineer Road Logistics (m/w/d)
1466630.description:
Job description:
It's more than a job
In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel's global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.
Are you a talented DevOps engineer with a passion for automation and solving complex challenges? Join our international team in Tallinn and play a pivotal role in building and supporting the successful delivery of value in our Road Logistics products.
The main focus of this role is development-oriented. You will design, implement, and maintain the DevOps platform that supports the development process and release pipelines for Road Logistics applications throughout the entire software development lifecycle. A key aspect of the role is optimizing workflows through automation and well-architected systems. Additionally, you will be involved in migrating applications to containers and cloud environments, including OpenShift, Kubernetes, and AWS. Ensuring the efficient utilization of cloud-based infrastructure and services across all teams is essential, preventing silos or knowledge islands. You will also champion best practices such as observability, Infrastructure-as-Code, and GitOps, seamlessly integrating them into the existing infrastructure and processes.
How you create impact
Taking part in managing non-production and production environments for Road Logistics applications.
Implementing observability pillars with centralized monitoring, logging and alerting.
Automating tasks and processes as much as possible.
Collaborating with infrastructure and product development teams to improve applications and processes.
Ensure security and compliance across all stages of the software development lifecycle.
Promoting DevOps culture and mindset.
What we would like you to bring
Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar role (DevOps Engineer, SRE, or Platform Engineer).
Hands-on experience with at least one major cloud provider, preferably AWS.
Strong Linux background with experience in configuration management tools (Ansible preferred).
Proficiency in CI/CD tools, ideally Jenkins or GitLab, with experience in automation and deployment.
Scripting skills for automating routine tasks using Python, Groovy, or Bash.
Expertise in container tooling and orchestration, such as Kubernetes or OpenShift.
Ability to develop scalable solutions that do not reinvent the wheel but can rather themselves serve as blueprints for tackling similar or even new challenges.
Experience working in hybrid infrastructures, securely connecting cloud and on-premises environments, with strong collaboration skills in international teams and proficiency in English (spoken and written).
What's in it for you
Join Kuehne+Nagel's IT Hub in Tallinn, where your work will have a meaningful impact on the logistics industry. Here, you'll find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You'll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don't tick every box, we encourage you to apply your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.
Who we are
Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.
As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.
We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

1476220.title: Timber Sales Manager
1476220.description:
WHO YOU ARE:
As a person you are passionate about people, business, IKEA's purpose and continuously driving better performance. You are energized by increasing customer value, driving business growth and contributing to overall success and results through people. You inspire individuals and teams to accomplish organizational goals.

To be successful in this role, you have the following::
A university or educational school degree in a relevant field (e.g., Forestry). Over 4 years of experience in operational or tactical forestry sales decision-making forums. At least 3 years of experience in a leadership position. Proficient in Microsoft Office Package (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access) and forest management software and You can communicate confidently and clearly in English.
And of course, you are motivated by living the IKEA culture and values.

About the job:
The Timber Sales Manager contributes to the growth and secures sustained profitability of the business, in line with and building on the Ingka Investments Direction focusing on maximizing timber sales revenues.

More specifically, this means you will::
Lead and secure the development of sales
which reflects long and short-term strategic objectives of Ingka Investments and identifies business opportunities in the market;
Drive the commercial agenda to maximize the net present value of the forest assets;
Manage timber sales, budget items, and goals; monitor KPIs and take action on deviation;
Ensure full insight / transparency of gross timber incomes and cost items (harvesting costs, transportations costs, etc.);
Manage commercial relations with business partners or contractors of Ingka Investments;
Identify appropriate benchmarks that allow for assessing and adapting sales tactics under changing conditions in the timber market;
Secure access to the forest with commercial purposes.

We offer::
Exciting and responsible work in an international environment
Excellent working conditions
Opportunities for professional development and growth
Wide range of employees benefits

If you have any questions about the role and responsibilities, please contact Country Manager of Ingka Investments Estonia, Tauno Kusma:
tauno.kusma@ingka.com
We look forward to receiving your application letter and CV till 14th of Dec 2025.

1463322.title: Product Development Engineer – PPE & Hard Goods
1463322.description:
About us:
NoCry is an Estonian company with a small yet powerful team doing big things. We are one of the fastest-growing work gear brands on Amazon. With over 5 million customers worldwide, we aim to become the global go-to source for workwear and PPE.
Our Mission is to empower hardworking people with functional and durable gear crafted from real-world needs, not boardroom decisions.
We're looking for a
Junior Product Development Engineer,
someone who loves building things, experimenting, learning by doing, and turning ideas into real, testable products. If you enjoy prototyping and solving hands-on problems, and seeing your work come to life, we'd love to meet you.

What Youll Do:
Engineer and build prototypes
take product ideas from sketches to functional, testable prototypes using SolidWorks and rapid prototyping tools.
Solve real-world engineering problems
through creative thinking, iteration, and practical testing.
Design and develop mechanical systems
and components for PPE and workwear accessories, ensuring reliability and manufacturability.
Lead root-cause analysis
on design or production issues, developing practical and lasting fixes.
Continuously optimize designs
for strength, cost, usability, and assembly efficiency.
Support the full development
cycle from concept sketch to working prototype to production handoff.

To succeed in this role, you'll need::
A degree in Mechanical Engineering, Product Design, Industrial Design Engineering, or a related field.
Some experience with SolidWorks or any CAD software (student projects count!).
Basic understanding of manufacturing processes like injection molding or simple mechanical assemblies.
Curiosity, creativity, and a strong desire to build, test, learn, and improve.
Good problem-solving skills and the ability to take ownership of small projects.
Bonus points for:
Experience with 3D scanning technologies for precision modeling.
Background in wearable, ergonomic, sporting, safety, or tactical gear design.
Hands-on experience with high-volume manufacturing (die casting, machining, stamping).

What's it like to work with us?:
Joining our team offers a one-of-a-kind experience at Estonia's largest e-commerce company on Amazon. We're on a mission to establish ourselves as a top global brand in safety gear and work apparel, and you could play a pivotal role in our journey to success. Expect engaging and challenging work that directly influences our business outcomes. We have hybrid working opportunities, a Stebby package, and fun team gatherings.
We're excited to receive your application if you're fueled by passion, thrive on pushing boundaries, and crave an environment that fosters innovation, freedom, and responsibility.
Don't miss this opportunity to make a meaningful difference with us!

1465380.title: GRC Security Expert
1465380.description:
GRC Security Expert:
Company Description
Founded in 1999 and premium listed on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange, Playtech is a technology leader in the gambling industry with over 7,000 employees across 20 countries.
Playtech is the gambling industry's leading technology company delivering business intelligence-driven gambling software, services, content, and platform technology across the industry's most popular product verticals, including, casino, live casino, sports betting, virtual sports, bingo and poker. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtech.com & www.playtechpeople.com
Here at Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Recognising differences and ensuring our processes are transparent is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career?
Playtech's
Governance Risk and Compliance Unit
is looking for a
GRC Security Expert
with excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Press play and let us design future technology together!
Your influential mission. You will...
Define, establish and implement organizational information security processes, to ensure business, regulatory, legislative and contractual requirements and obligations are met.
Manage the internal and external ISMS audit processes, monitor effectiveness of controls and corrective actions in cooperation with the stakeholders across the organization.
Manage gap analysis, compliance readiness, and compliance monitoring activities for ISO/IEC 27001, PCI DSS and other regulatory security audits.
Coordinate external security audits, assessments and testing as well as remediation plans development and implementation.
Identify, assess and monitor information security risks and recommend mitigation measures.
Develop content, coordinate and facilitate a comprehensive organizational information security awareness training program.
Manage security requirements with third parties, including due diligence of products and services providers and information security requirements clauses in service provision agreements and contracts.
Develop, coordinate and maintain information security policies, procedures and other security related documents.
Analyse, map and communicate information security requirements, that derive from legislative and regulatory obligations in various jurisdictions.
Serve as project manager/lead within security projects.
Continually improve and update knowledge to accommodate changes to the company's regulatory environment and needs.
Components for success. You have...
Proven experience (3+ years) across security governance, risk and compliance domain
Strong communication skills and ability to interact professionally with a diverse group including executive management, managers and subject matter experts
Have strong management skills, leading people, delegating tasks, setting goals and ensuring objectives are met in continuous and deadline-oriented activities
Experience in leading PCI DSS ISO 27001:2022 and SOC/ISAE402 certification and surveillance audits as well as leading and supporting information security risk assessments and management process
Bachelors Degree in Information Security, Information Assurance, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Risk Management or equivalent work experience
Professional certification (CISSP/CISM and ISO 27001 Lead Implementer/Auditor or similar)
A pro-active, self-motivated approach and ability to work independently within a global security team.
Very good written and spoken English
You'll get extra points for...
Prior experience working within a SaaS/Online Gambling organization
Technical experience in IT infrastructure, networks, databases, or software development.
Thrive in a culture that values...
Initiative-taking and confident approach at the workplace
Global scope and inclusive working environment
Constant learning and development opportunities
Active lifestyle and mental well-being
Fun and engaging company events
Additional Information
GOVERNANCE RISK & COMPLIANCE UNIT
At our GRC Security business unit, we view every challenge as a stepping stone towards innovation and growth. We are on the lookout for individuals who are not just curious, but also thrive in team environments. If you have a passion for exploring new cybersecurity frameworks and solutions, then you are the one we are looking for. Join us, and turn challenges into opportunities for learning and innovation.
Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

1469103.title: Senior Technical Marketing Operations Manager
1469103.description:
Ootused kandidaadile:
Malwarebytes Marketing and Customer Value team is dedicated to providing engaging and impactful experiences for our customers. We focus on generating sustained growth through innovative and purpose-driven marketing programs. We are seeking a Senior Marketing Operations Technical Marketing Manager who will bring a customer-first approach to our team.
This high-visibility individual will work alongside multiple teams, such as Marketing, Ecom, Product, Analytics, Data Engineering, and various stakeholders, to support Email and SMS communications by building marketing and product communications. This includes working on end-to-end emails, from creative assets to real-time API-triggered emails to batch email deployments.
Skills You'll Need to Have:
5+ years of experience integrating and supporting enterprise email/SMS platforms such as Iterable, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Campaign, or similar
Strong proficiency in building and managing API-driven workflows, including RESTful service integration and webhook/event handling.
5+ years of experience in SQL and working with relational databases or data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery)
Extensive experience with email or in-product lifecycle marketing campaigns
Experience in designing and maintaining data pipelines for syncing customer profiles, events, and catalog data into messaging platforms.
Strong understanding of data mapping, schema validation, and identity resolution in omnichannel marketing contexts.
Solid grasp of email/SMS deliverability principles, consent management, and compliance (e.g., CAN-SPAM, GDPR, CCPA).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills for gathering requirements and coordinating across Marketing, Data Engineering, and Analytics teams.
BA/BS in marketing or related field preferred

Tööülesannete kirjeldus:
Build and deploy campaigns using Iterable (experience with Responsys, Braze, Exact Target or similar tools welcome)
Demonstrated advanced proficiency in leveraging AI tools and automation to design, execute, and optimize marketing campaigns.
Work in lockstep with Customer Marketing and Product Marketing to plan and execute messaging strategies across email, in-app, and other channels.
Collaborate with business stakeholders (e.g., Marketing, Product, Analytics) to gather and translate technical specifications into campaigns and automation requirements
Work with data engineers to help design, implement, and maintain system integrations between Iterable and upstream systems (e.g., HighTouch, Snowflake, eCommerce platforms, data lakes).
Develop and support data pipelines (batch and real-time) to ensure timely and accurate delivery of audience, events, and transactional data into Iterable
Own and optimize API-based integrations using Iterables REST API and event/webhook framework.
Implement robust data mapping and transformation logic to align source data structures with Iterables user profiles, custom events, and catalog data models.
Create and manage workflow automation and trigger logic for event-based campaigns (e.g., abandon cart, lifecycle messaging).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Data Engineering, Analytics, DevOps) to ensure campaign readiness and data accuracy.

Omalt poolt pakume:
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage
Employee Referral Bonus Program
Wellness programs
An opportunity to do something great for yourself and the world!

1469463.title: Mapping Team Lead
1469463.description:
Starship Technologies is revolutionizing deliveries with autonomous robots. These robots are designed to deliver food, groceries, and packages across college campuses and neighborhoods in minutes. Starship has now completed millions of autonomous deliveries to date, traveled millions of miles, and is currently doing more than 140k road crossings each day. Our contribution to society includes reducing congestion, and pollution, providing zero-emissions deliveries, increasing the quality of life for residents, empowering seniors and disabled people, and enabling affordable delivery for local businesses.
With over 300 locations in 6 countries worldwide, we have brought a series of world firsts as we launched robotic delivery in new cities, areas, and countries. Our deliveries are profitable due to significant technology investment, and combined with substantial commercial momentum and interest, expanding to new partners and locations has become the beating heart of our growth.
Were looking for a
Mapping Team Lead
to join our
Autonomous Driving team
. Mapping Team is one of the three pillars of our ability to expand and scale with confidence they are responsible for, critically, high-precision maps that make our robots smarter, safer and faster. This is a unique opportunity to lead, shape, and drive a critical part of how we adapt robotics to fit, suit, and serve local communities in countries across the world.
Your main responsibilities are:
Prioritisation & Planning
Drive excellent prioritisation, scheduling, and planning to maximise price-to-performance impact across the team.
Plan and sequence work across map additions, geographic expansions, and safety-critical tasks.
Use data fluently to forecast hiring needs, track performance, and guide operational decisions.
Cross-Functional Teamwork
Collaborate closely with teams such as Commercial, Launch, Public Affairs, and Local/Remote Operations to ensure alignment, clarity, and shared outcomes.
High Velocity Execution
Operate effectively in a fast-moving environment with rapidly increasing launch velocity.
Stay calm, decisive, and outcome-focused amid ambiguity, shifting deadlines, and incomplete information.
Operational & Tooling Improvements
Identify and drive improvements in tools, software, workflows, and systems to increase efficiency, safety, and long-term scalability.
Advocate for automation and scalable long-term solutions.
Team Growth & Development
Grow, mentor, and develop a high-impact team with strong ownership, engagement, and clarity of purpose.
Lead the evolution of team responsibilities as Starship changes and as automation changes processes.
What's in it for you?
This is a wildly unique role: an opportunity to lead a key scaling team, working to expand industry-leading self-driving delivery robot technology on a uniquely large scale, creating history.
You will have the opportunity to shape and build a unique system for expansion, and to grow the team around it, including working with sister engineering teams in Autonomous Driving to improve the process of expansion.
Work with extremely passionate and motivated people across the company in operations, engineering and commercial.
You can immerse yourself in the world of technology and innovation.
You'll have endless opportunities to learn from our inspirational, talented team members across the globe.
What we hope you'll bring to the table:
Experience in data analysis (including exploratory analysis) and using data for decision-making and forecasting.
Ability to think strategically, predict outcomes, and guide teams to adapt effectively.
Proven team leadership experience: mentoring, growing, and motivating a team to deliver impact.
A proven ability to thrive under pressure, tight deadlines, and changing conditions.
Exceptional prioritisation skills across very different tasks and outcomes.
Excellent communicator with strong relationship-building skills, able to align, inspire, and collaborate across teams.
Want to learn more about our robots and our people? Get in touch and lets have a chat! Also, have a sneak peek to our blog and discover more about us!

1468873.title: Platform Operations Engineer
1468873.description:
Your new adventure:
As a Platform Operations Engineer, you will join our global Internal IT team and play an essential part in our mission to provide the world with affordable and environment-friendly deliveries. Every day, our robots are completing thousands of autonomous deliveries in the US, UK and Europe, and were hitting records on an almost weekly basis.
This role is a direct step toward proactive Platform Engineering moving us beyond daily operational IT into true system ownership and security optimization. Your primary responsibility will be serving as the resident expert for the security and optimization of our core collaboration and productivity platforms. Your focus will be on eliminating manual work through automation and enforcing a strong security posture.

Your main responsibilities::
Core Platform Administration: Lead the management of Okta (IAM, SSO, MFA, provisioning) ; administration, security management and automations in Google Workspace, Atlassian (Jira/Confluence workflows), Slack etc.
Automation Engineering: Utilize scripting (e.g. Python, PowerShell, Google Apps Script) to automate administrative tasks, eliminate manual work, and build reliable integrations between internal applications.
Security & Governance: Implement access lifecycle management, and regularly review and improve information security in internal tools. Contribute to various regular security assessment reviews.
Tier 2 Escalation: Act as the final technical expert for platform-related issues, providing advanced troubleshooting beyond standard support channels.
Documentation: Create and maintain high-quality documentation for configurations, procedures, and governance.

What's in it for you? :
You will collaborate with people with a strong inner burning and motivation. We are self-aware and seek feedback and improvement. We take pride in our ability to make the most of limited resources to solve problems no one has ever encountered before.
We are a fast-growing startup, with great opportunities to grow within the company. Your contribution will matter. There are lots of ways you can make a difference and personally feel the impact.
Youll have endless opportunities to learn from our inspirational, talented team members across the globe.

What we hope you'll bring to the table: :
Hands-on experience in cloud application or systems administration within a fast-growing business environment.
Expertise in the administration and architecture of at least one of the following: Okta, Atlassian (Jira/Confluence), Google Workspace, or Slack. Since you will be the lead admin for all core platforms, demonstrable experience across a combination of these systems is a significant advantage.
Strong practical understanding of Identity and Access Management (IAM) principles and security controls (MFA, DLP).
Experience in scripting for automation (e.g., Python, PowerShell) to manage systems and integrations is a strong advantage.
Excellent verbal and written English skills are required to clearly communicate complex technical requirements to non-technical stakeholders.
A strong collaborator eager to work cross-functionally and contribute to shared team goals.

1475010.title: Principal Systems & Safety Engineer
1475010.description:
Starship Technologies is revolutionizing deliveries with autonomous robots. These robots are designed to deliver food, groceries, and packages across college campuses and neighborhoods in minutes. Starship has now completed millions of autonomous deliveries to date, traveled millions of miles, and is currently doing more than 140k road crossings each day. Our contribution to society includes reducing congestion and pollution, providing zero-emissions deliveries, increasing the quality of life for residents, empowering seniors and disabled people, and enabling affordable delivery for local businesses.
We're hitting records on an almost weekly basis. Now is an exciting time to join as we grow rapidly around the world!
We're looking for a
Principal Systems & Safety Engineer
to join our
Hardware Engineering team
. As a Principal Systems & Safety Engineer, you'll play a critical role in our product development process for robots from concept to launch. You will be a key technical voice on product safety and compliance, ensuring our system architecture and design meet and exceed regulatory requirements. This is an opportunity to have a major impact on our products and grow your leadership skills by driving significant improvements in our compliance framework.
Your main responsibilities are:
Driving improvements to our compliance framework: You'll identify opportunities and lead initiatives to make a step-change improvement in our existing compliance and safety processes, ensuring we stay ahead of global standards (e.g., CE, IEC, ISO, UL).
Translating standards into requirements: You'll analyse complex safety standards and regulations and translate them into clear, verifiable system and subsystem requirements for our hardware and software teams.
Analysing system architecture: You'll review the system architectures to identify potential hazards, ensure safety-critical functions are robust, and guide design choices from the start.
Conducting technical risk assessments: You'll lead and document technical risk assessments, including Hazard Analysis and Risk Assessment (HARA) and Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) at the system level.
Contributing to product certifications: You'll be a key part of the certification process, preparing technical documentation and collaborating with external labs to ensure successful product validation.
Developing validation strategies: You'll work with our test and validation teams to create and execute test plans that verify compliance and validate the safety of the overall system.
What's in it for you?
Opportunity to work on industry-leading self-driving delivery robot technology on a uniquely large scale, creating history and making things happen.
You can immerse yourself in the world of technology and innovation.
You will have a chance to work with people with a strong inner burning and motivation. We are self-aware and seek feedback and improvement. We don't want to wait until we are told what needs to be done but take it as a matter of pride to figure out solutions for topics in various teams and areas.
You'll have endless opportunities to learn from our inspirational, talented team members across the globe.
What we're looking for:
A systems-level thinker: You can understand how different components of a complex system interact and can anticipate potential failure modes.
A passion for building safe, complex systems: You're excited about the challenge of building robust consumer robots and are committed to ensuring they are safe and reliable.
A growth mindset: You're eager to learn and grow, and you're not afraid to take on new challenges. We're looking for someone who wants to become a leader in this field.
A collaborative spirit: You're a great communicator and enjoy working with cross-functional teams to solve challenging problems.
A proactive problem-solver: You're a self-starter who can identify potential issues and develop creative solutions.
We'd love to hear from you if you have:
Extensive experience in systems engineering, compliance, safety, or a related role.
Familiarity with product safety standards (e.g., IEC 61508, ISO 26262, UL 3300).
Proven experience writing and managing technical requirements.
Strong background in risk assessment methodologies (e.g., FMEA, HARA).
If you're excited about this role but don't meet all the requirements, we'd still encourage you to apply.
Want to learn more about our robots and our people? Get in touch and lets have a chat! Also, have a sneak peek to our blog and discover more about us!

Minimizing environmental and social impact, especially near protected Natura 2000 areas.
Managing subcontractors and service providers, ensuring quality and performance.

Taking ownership of budgeting and cost control within assigned work packages.
What You Bring:

Certification: Valid authorization to manage large-scale construction works.
Experience: Proven track record in large-scale earthworks and infrastructure projects.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in CAD, MS Office, and familiarity with CDE platforms. Experience with Last Planner System and Situational Awareness Systems is a plus.
Language: Good knowledge of English verbally and written.
Soft Skills That Set You Apart:

Ability to thrive in multicultural, international teams.
Strong sense of collaboration, transparency, and respect for cultural differences.
High resilience and adaptability in fast-paced environments.
Why Join Budimex?
Be part of a landmark European infrastructure project.
Work in a collaborative Alliance model with leading industry partners.
Make a real impact on sustainable development and regional connectivity.
Grow your career in a dynamic, international environment.

1467387.title: Infrastructure Regulations Support Project Manager
1467387.description:
Infrastructure Regulations Support Project Manager:
PARENTAL COVER
Founded in 1999 and premium listed on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange, Playtech is a technology leader in the gambling industry with over 7,000 employees across 20 countries.
Playtech is the gambling industry's leading technology company delivering business intelligence-driven gambling software, services, content, and platform technology across the industry's most popular product verticals, including, casino, live casino, sports betting, virtual sports, bingo and poker. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtech.com & www.playtechpeople.com
Here at Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Recognizing differences and ensuring our processes are transparent is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career?
Playtech's INFRASTRUCTURE UNIT
is looking for a proactive
Regulations Support Project Manager
with great communication skills.
Press play and let us design future technology together!
Job Description
Your influential mission. You will...
Lead and coordinate regulatory projects and requests in the Infrastructure Business Unit
Interpret audit controls to understand what is requested, gather the needed evidence from technical teams & defend it in audit session calls
Be the representative contact point for all internal & external technical audits (both written and verbal) for the Playtech Infrastructure
Create and maintain an information knowledge base in the Infrastructure unit to support the business
Communicate inside the Infrastructure unit, the Compliance, Security, and product delivery teams of Playtech to ensure a smooth information flow
Participate in the creation of infrastructure-related documentation and policies
Qualifications
Components for success. You...
Have a proactive approach to your responsibilities and a willingness to take ownership of your domain
Have strong analytical capabilities and attention to detail
Are confident and excellent communicator, both in verbal conversations and in writing
Keep cool under pressure and stressful situations
Are a true team player at heart and skilled in building relationships
You'll get extra points for...
Having previous experience with standards and regulatory audits
Having previous working experience in IT
Having previous experience in working with legal documentation and regulations
Thrive in a culture that values...
Initiative-taking and confident approach at the workplace
Global scope and inclusive working environment
Constant learning and development opportunities
Active lifestyle and mental well-being
Fun and engaging company events
Additional Information
REGULATIONS SUPPORT PROJECT MANAGERS TEAM
The team is a part of Playtech's Infrastructure unit that provides private cloud platform services to all Playtech Products. Our small, tight-knit team keenly monitors our business unit's compliance with all regulations' requirements and our high standards of responsible gambling. We use our analytical skills to understand audit controls, communication skills to gather and present the needed evidence, and our trait for attention to detail to map it all to our knowledge base.
Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

1472277.title: Product Owner (Mechanical)
1472277.description:
Role overview: :
We're looking for an experienced Product Owner/Mechanical Engineer with strong NPI and product ownership expertise to join our Product Development team at Stargate Hydrogen. You will be responsible for managing the complete mechanical integration lifecycle - from product introduction through serial manufacturing - with a strong focus on engineering documentation control, change management, and ensuring seamless transitions from development to production.
If you have hands-on experience with complex mechanical product development, serial manufacturing, ERP systems, and take pride in owning products from conception to scaled production, this role offers the perfect opportunity to make a tangible impact in the hydrogen technology sector. You're naturally detail-oriented, thrive in collaborative environments, and are ready to drive quality and efficiency across engineering, production, and quality functions.
We are seeking candidates currently located in Estonia.
Must-have qualifications:
University degree in Engineering, Physics or Chemistry
2+ years in mechanical product development and serial manufacturing
Proven NPI experience from development to production
Strong CAD and PDM/PLM skills for design and document control
ERP experience in engineering documentation and BoM management
Strong process orientation and attention to traceability
Excellent problem-solving and ownership mindset
Strong teamwork and communication skills in English
Nice-to-have qualifications:
Project or program management experience
Product ownership background, managing design revisions and lifecycle
Advanced Inventor and Vault proficiency
Experience with alkaline electrolyser stacks or components
Expertise in mechanical design for manufacturability
Knowledge of hydrogen/process industry manufacturing
Familiarity with DfM principles
Understanding of ISO 22734, PED, ISO 9001, ISO 13849

What does day-to-day look like in this role? :
Engineering Documentation & ERP Management
Own and maintain mechanical design documentation in the ERP system BoMs, drawings, 3D/CAD data, and specifications. Ensure all records are accurate, traceable, and version-controlled, keeping production, quality, and suppliers aligned with the latest data.
New Product Introduction (NPI)
Lead mechanical integration for new product launches, managing the transition from development to serial production. Secure production readiness through complete documentation, validated processes, and qualified suppliers. Coordinate with engineering, production, quality, and supply teams to meet timelines and standards.
Change Implementation & Design Upgrades
Manage design changes and upgrades driven by production feedback or improvement initiatives. Conduct impact analyses, lead reviews, align stakeholders, and control timing of change implementation to ensure full compliance with updated specs.
Serial Production Support
Be the technical bridge between engineering and production. Support troubleshooting, non-conformance resolution, and root cause analysis. Coordinate corrective actions with suppliers and participate in risk analyses (FMEA, HAZOP).
Supplier Coordination
Define and maintain technical specifications for critical components. Oversee supplier documentation, compliance, and communication. Support problem-solving and ensure specifications are implemented correctly in production.
Process & Documentation Optimisation
Continuously improve workflows for product changes, documentation, and supplier management. Capture production and quality feedback to refine NPI and preventive processes for future releases.

Why us?:
You will join a world-class team of 65+ experienced and goal-driven professionals and hydrogentechnology experts
We are an agile scale-up wishing to make a difference in a field typically dominated by large andslow behemoths
We have secured a €29m state aid via the Important Projects of Common European Interest (IPCEI) framework, and are backed by our existing investors such as UGI and Repsol
The performance of our ceramic electrode technology has been independently validated by Fraunhofer IFAM in Dresden, and the performance of our prototype stack by ZSW in Stuttgart
Whats in it for you?
You will be able to contribute to electrolysis technology and its novel applications, thereby participating in creating a net-zero world
You can accelerate your career and enjoy professional growth opportunities
We have a flexible policy you can organise your work between the office and remotely to get the best results and enjoy flexible working hours
You can choose between employer health insurance or sports compensation
We organise regular team events and company Summer Days that foster camaraderie, collaboration, and fun outside of the workplace
If you're interested in relocation, we're based in Estonia, which offers a flat income tax of 22%, great access to abundant nature and is the most advanced digital society
We aim to fill this position at the earliest opportunity, so we encourage interested candidates to submit their applications promptly.
You can expect a response from us within two weeks of your application date.

1476464.title: Senior Backend Engineer (m\w\d)
1476464.description:
Job description:
It's more than a job
In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagels' global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.
As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will be part of the team owning the development of scalable, accessible and performant web interfaces to deliver intuitive user experiences that align with KNs brand and business goals. You will lead the backend architectural decisions and ensure long-term maintainability of the systems. This role is critical for maintaining and evolving the backend and middleware systems that power KNs global websites and digital platforms. You will work closely with frontend developers, DevOps engineers and QA experts to deliver scalable, secure and high-performing solutions.
How you create impact
Design, develop, and maintain backend services and middleware components for KNs global web platforms.
Ensure quality through automated testing (unit, integration, UI, performance).
Design and optimize database models and queries, ensuring efficient performance and scalability for high-traffic environments.
Follow clean code practices and development standards while actively participating in code reviews, architecture discussions, and continuous improvement initiatives.
Proactively improve the codebase: refactor for simplicity, performance, and maintainability on a continuous basis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (PO, Frontend, DevOps, QA) to ensure seamless integration and deployment.
Implement best practices for security, data integrity, and API design.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues in production environments.
What we would like you to bring
5+ years of experience in backend development, preferably in enterprise-scale environments.
Strong proficiency in Java, Spring Boot, Kotlin and RESTful API development.
Experience with middleware technologies and integration patterns.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and version control (GitLab, Bitbucket).
Understanding of security best practices and performance optimisation.
Nice to have experience with CMS platforms (StoryBlok) and knowledge of microservices architecture and event-driven systems.
Exposure to observability tools and monitoring frameworks.
What's in it for you
Join Kuehne+Nagel's IT Hub in Tallinn, where your work will have a meaningful impact on the logistics industry. Here, you'll find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You'll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don't tick every box, we encourage you to apply - your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

1460953.description:

Act as a communication bridge: ping stakeholders, request missing info, follow up on deadlines.
Log operational activities and updates in workflow systems for transparency.

What we offer:

1473499.title: Employer Branding and Communications Partner
1473499.description:
Employer Branding and Communications Partner :
About Playtech
Founded in 1999, Playtech has a premium listing on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange and is focused on regulated and regulating markets across its B2B business. By leveraging proprietary technology, Playtech delivers innovative products and services to ensure a safe, engaging, and entertaining gaming experience.
As the gaming industry's leading technology company, Playtech combines business intelligence-driven software, services, content, and platform technology to drive excellence and innovation across the sector. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtechpeople.com and www.playtech.com.
At Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Embracing differences and maintaining transparency in our processes is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career?
Are you passionate about shaping how a leading tech company is seen by the world? Playtech Estonia is searching for an enthusiastic
Employer Branding and Communications Partner
to drive our brand and communications strategy locally and support globally. If you thrive in a dynamic environment, love building relationships, and want to make a real impact, this is your chance to join a team where your ideas matter.
Your Influential Mission: You Will...
Local Focus
Lead impactful communication:
Drive external and internal communications for Playtech Estonia, ensuring our voice is clear, engaging, and aligned with our brand.
Shape our employer brand:
Develop and execute strategies that position Playtech as a top employer in Estonias tech industry.
Showcase Playtech at events:
Organize and manage our presence at career fairs and IT conferences, creating memorable experiences for attendees.
Be our ambassador:
Host office visits for guests and students, sharing Playtechs culture and values.
Manage public engagement:
Respond to external inquiries, sponsorship requests, and collaboration opportunities with professionalism and creativity.
Lead CSR initiatives:
Drive local Corporate Social Responsibility projects and contribute to global programs that make a positive impact.
Empower brand ambassadors:
Coordinate and inspire our local Brand Ambassador group to strengthen internal engagement.
Create engaging content:
Manage Playtech Estonias social media channels (Facebook, Instagram) with fresh, authentic content.
Global Focus
Lead internal and global People and Culture communications:
Collaborate with global teams to keep employees informed and engaged, manage the communications calendar, and ensure consistent messaging across regions.
Develop and deliver People & Culture communications:
Create and implement content, maintain templates, and coordinate timing to align global and local priorities.
Components for Success: You...
Are proactive, independent, and confident in decision-making.
Build strong relationships across all levels and functions.
Demonstrate fluency in Estonian (native level) and English (both written and spoken).
Bring hands-on experience in employer branding, communications, or related fields.
Have a higher education (Bachelors or Masters) in marketing, communications, business, or a relevant area, or equivalent practical experience.
Possess an analytical mindset, able to use data and insights to drive strategy and improvements.
Thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment, creating structure and processes where needed.
You'll Get Extra Points For...
Experience in digital marketing, social media management, or content creation.
Certifications in communications, marketing, or related fields.
Previous achievements in employer branding or communications roles.
Experience organizing or supporting CSR initiatives.
Knowledge of the Estonian tech industry or labor market.
Thrive in a Culture That Values...
Independence and trust, no micromanagement, just empowerment.
Collaboration with passionate, supportive colleagues.
Opportunities for growth, development, and making a real impact.
A diverse, inclusive, and welcoming environment.
How to Apply?
In addition to your CV, please add a brief
cover
letter covering your goals, your current experience in employer branding, communications, or related fields, and/or working in a corporate environment. You can write it in the comment section at the end of the application page (under "your message to the hiring manager").
Meet the Team
Join a vibrant, collaborative team at Playtech Estonia, where your ideas and expertise will help shape our employer brand and communications strategy. Youll work alongside passionate professionals who value initiative, creativity, and partnership. Be part of a business thats making a difference, locally and globally.
Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

1463659.title: Operational manager
1463659.description:
Operational Manager (Entry to Mid-Level):
We are looking for a practical and responsible person who enjoys working with their hands and figuring out how things work. You do not need to already be a laundry technician what matters is curiosity, initiative, and willingness to learn step-by-step.
You will help keep our self-service laundromat locations running smoothly and make sure customers have a good experience. A lot of learning will happen directly from real situations, with support from teammates across the Baltics.
This role is active and varied, not a desk job:
some days you will be on-site checking machines and equipment,
other days you will be answering customer calls or helping on-site,
and at times you will be preparing improvements or assisting in opening new laundromats.

What the job includes::
- Visiting laundromat locations to check equipment and overall condition
- Ensuring washing machines and dryers work properly (we will guide you as you learn)
- Solving practical technical issues when they appear
- Helping customers by phone and sometimes on-site
- Keeping track of tasks and making sure they are completed
- Assisting with installations or adjustments when opening new laundromats
- Organizing and overseeing cleaning and basic maintenance work
Learning here is
hands-on
and gradual you will build your knowledge step by step.

Who will fit well in this role:
- You like working with tools and equipment
- You are not afraid to learn by doing and ask questions when needed
- You think calmly and logically when solving problems
- You take responsibility and finish what you start
- You can plan your time and work independently once you know what to do
- You speak
Estonian, English
and
Russian
- You have a
B-category drivers license
and
your own car
(fuel and car wear are compensated)
- You can provide references
No formal technical education is required. The key factor is
motivation to learn
.

Why join us?:
- The chance to learn practical technical skills that are valuable in many careers
- Real responsibility and visible results when you fix something, it matters immediately
- Varied work in different locations (not sitting behind a screen all day)
- Supportive colleagues across Baltics learning happens together
- The opportunity to grow into wider responsibilities as your skills develop (technical maintenance, location operations, installation projects)
If you are someone who enjoys practical work, wants to learn how equipment works, and takes pride in doing things well we would be glad to talk.

Working hours::
Full-time

Workplace::
Primary Tallin, but spots to be supervised could be spread across all Estonia

Salary::
Salary: up to 2500 EUR/month gross, depending on experience and skill level. Salary increases as your skills and responsibilities grow.
www.laundromat.ee

, is a leading player in the

,

;

🌟 We Offer

with 150+ years of history;
Participation in

and real industrial applications;
Professional growth

supportive and experienced engineering team
;

A role where your
engineering ideas become real products
.

If you're passionate about circuit design and want to contribute to the future of power electronics, we'd love to hear from you!

1466614.title: Network Operations Engineer
1466614.description:
Network Operations Engineer:
About Playtech
Founded in 1999, the company has a premium listing on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange and is focused on regulated and regulating markets across its B2B business. By leveraging its proprietary technology, Playtech delivers innovative products and services to ensure a safe, engaging and entertaining gaming experience.
As the gaming industry's leading technology company, it combines business intelligence-driven software, services, content, and platform technology to drive excellence and innovation across the sector. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtechpeople.com and www.playtech.com
Here at Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Embracing differences and maintaining transparency in our processes is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career? Join Playtech as a Network Operations Engineer!
Are you ready to make an impact in the world of cutting-edge infrastructure?
Playtech's
Infrastructure team is searching for a driven and innovative
Network Operations Engineer
to help keep the digital gears turning smoothly. If solving challenges excites you and networking is your playground, this is the opportunity you've been waiting for.
Your influential mission. You will...
Keep Things Running: Manage and support critical networking components to ensure uninterrupted service.
Shape the Future: Maintain firewall rules and configure load-balancer business logic with the guidance of an experienced team.
Innovate & Experiment: Be part of infrastructure-focused R&D projects that push boundaries.
Build Smarter: Help to develop automation tools to optimize processes.
Be the Guardian: Take on on-call duties to ensure network infrastructure remains rock-solid 24/7.
Components for success. You...
Are a Creative Thinker: You approach problems like a true engineer, thinking outside the box and crafting both tailored and standardized solutions.
Excel as a Networking Pro: You're experienced in building and maintaining robust network infrastructures that support diverse products.
Demonstrate Technical Know-How: Your hands-on expertise spans firewalls, load balancers, switches, routers, and DDoS mitigation solutions (bonus points if CheckPoint, F5, Juniper, or Cisco is in your arsenal!).
Remain Cool Under Pressure: You excel in dynamic situations, adapting quickly and strategically while juggling multiple tasks with precision.
Leverage Automator Extraordinaire: You prefer to work smart by leveraging scripting, automation, and orchestration tools.
Communicate and Connect Effectively: With your polished English communication skills, you effortlessly collaborate with colleagues and clients.
You'll get extra points for...
Familiarity with cloud networking concepts and public cloud platforms (like AWS) gives you a winning edge!
Thrive in a culture that values...
Innovative Projects: Tackle unique challenges with industry-leading tools and technology.
Expert Mentorship: Work alongside top-notch specialists and accelerate your learning.
Holistic Growth: Enjoy support for your professional journey, active lifestyle, and mental well-being.
Community Spirit: Engage in exciting events and enjoy perks that make you proud to belong.
INFRASTRUCTURE UNIT
Our infrastructure is spread over 20 different countries and 34 data centers. We rely on 25 000 virtual machines and have 39 000 TB of storage space.
Impressive? Using cutting-edge technologies, we provide central IT infrastructure services to business and internal customers worldwide.
NETWORK OPERATIONS TEAM
The Network Operations team is a dynamic and highly skilled group of Engineers who are ensuring the seamless functioning of digital networks. They possess a deep understanding of complex network architectures and protocols, allowing them to tackle any challenge that comes their way. With our collaborative spirit and unwavering commitment to excellence, we form a cohesive team that thrives on innovation and pushes the boundaries of what is possible in the world of networking.
Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

1471615.title: Malware Research Engineer
1471615.description:
Ootused kandidaadile:
Highly developed sense of integrity and demonstrated passion for excellence with respect to treating and caring for customers.
Creative thinking and problem solving, with a positive and motivated approach.
Ability to setup and conduct research/analysis in an emulated/virtual environment, such as VMWare or Hyper-V.
Ability to research & classify malicious domains and IPs.
Experience with and understanding of malware research tools involved in static & dynamic analysis and core aspects of a threat research & response team.
Basic understanding and experience using various operating systems, incl. Windows, Linux, Mac, and Android.
Ability and passion to stay up to date with the latest malware threats and collaborate with other researchers, coordinators, as well as developers.

Tööülesannete kirjeldus:
Process daily threat-feeds, related to newly created malware and write detection rules for various technologies.
Investigate and resolve customer related inquiries related to protection, performance, and usability.
Conduct research and threat hunting for the latest cyber-web threats affecting our customers.
Provide feedback on new projects and syntaxes/tools being developed that involve your daily work and suggest ideas how to handle different threat types.
Support content creation efforts incl. threat descriptions, blogs, and presentations

Omalt poolt pakume:
Employee Referral Bonus Program

1470704.title: Senior Backend Engineer
1470704.description:
What will help you to succeed in the role: :
Hands-on experience with C# and the .NET framework, with a minimum of 5 years of experience
Experience developing, shipping, and maintaining cloud-based applications
Good knowledge and experience working with microservices and distributed architectures
Strong understanding of RESTful APIs
Experience with relational databases, preferably Microsoft SQL Server
Working knowledge of ORMs, preferably Entity Framework
Familiarity with cloud development; experience with Azure is a plus
Experience with messaging platforms in distributed architectures (e.g., RabbitMQ, MassTransit, Kafka)
Proficiency with containerization technologies such as Docker
Experience with Kubernetes for container orchestration
Terraform for Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Monitoring and observability experience using tools like NewRelic
Proficiency in both written and spoken English
Experience in the FinTech or banking industry is a plus

What will be your challenge: :
You will join one of our product teams and daily you will:
Design, develop, test, and ship robust, maintainable, and readable software, applications, APIs, and other workflows
Initiate, participate in, and communicate technical architecture designs
Attend regular scrum ceremonies as a member of an agile cross-functional team
Analyze, discuss, and implement business requirements while maintaining good documentation of the systems and components you create
Bring in industry standards and best practices to continually improve our codebase and architecture
Make a positive impact on our engineering culture by adopting, implementing, and providing feedback on both organizational and industry standards and practices

What do we offer: :
Inclusive and valuing culture
At Riverty, you can be who you are. We strive to create an inclusive environment and an appreciative culture, enhanced by our employee networks.
Health & Wellbeing
Your physical and mental health is important to us. Take advantage of our various preventive care and support services.
Professional and Personal Development
Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities. Benefit, for example, from training courses offered by Bertelsmann University, language courses or leadership trainings
Monetary Benefits & Discounts
Know that you're appreciated with plenty of employee benefits & discounts just for you.
Flexibility
Our diverse working models empower you to customize your work to perfectly align with your preferences. Benefit from mobile office, flexible working hours and part-time models.

1474682.title: French & Spanish Teacher (Full-time)
1474682.description:
French Teacher :
The International School of Estonia (ISE) invites applications for the position of
Full-Time French & Spanish Teacher, starting August 2026.
ISE is a private, co-educational, not-for-profit institution located in Tallinn, Estonia. It is the only fully accredited international school in the country, authorised to deliver the full International Baccalaureate (IB) Continuum (PYP, MYP, and DP), and accredited by both the New England Association of Schools and Colleges (NEASC) and the Council of International Schools (CIS).
Essential Qualifications:
University degree in Education or relevant field.
Certified qualification as a French & Spanish teacher (candidates currently completing certification will also be considered).
Ability to provide a recent
clear police record / criminal background check
Desirable Qualifications and Professional Attributes:
Training and/or experience in the IB PYP, MYP, DP.
Demonstrated commitment to high standards of teaching and learning.
Capacity to inspire, motivate, and support students in achieving their potential.
Professionalism, flexibility, and a collaborative approach to working within an international school environment.
Conditions of Appointment:
ISE offers a competitive salary and, for overseas candidates, an additional benefits package that includes: accommodation allowance, relocation & support, comprehensive international medical insurance.
Application Procedure:
Applications should include:
A letter of interest and introduction
Curriculum Vitae
Contact details of two professional referees
Completed applications should be submitted electronically to vacancies@ise.edu.ee
no later than January 31, 2026.
Please note:
The school reserves the right to appoint a suitable candidate prior to the closing date. Only candidates shortlisted for an interview will be contacted.
Further information about ISE can be found at https://ise.edu.ee

1474684.title: Estonian Language & Culture Teacher (Part-Time/Full-Time)
1474684.description:
Estonian Language & Culture Teacher Vacancy part-time/full time:
ISE is seeking to appoint a part-time
Estonian Language & Culture Teacher
to start in February 2026, with the strong possibility of the role growing into a full-time position. International School of Estonia is a private, co-educational, not-for-profit school, located in Estonia (Tallinn).  ISE is a fully authorised International Baccalaureate Continuum World School. It is also accredited with NEASC and CIS, and as such, is the only triple authorised/ accredited International School in Estonia.
Qualifications /prerequisites
Degree-qualified, certified Teacher with a formal, degree-level studies in language education, preferably with a focus on Estonian.
At least 2 years of experience in a similar position.
Additional Desirable Qualifications:
Commitment to model the behavioural competencies of the IB Learner Profile
Training and experience teaching the IB Primary Years Programme of the International Baccalaureate
An understanding of inquiry learning and the importance of student agency.
Good skills using instructional technology and experience in differentiated classroom teaching.
A knowledge of/passion for the International Baccalaureate,
Strong desire to be an inspiring, motivated educator.
Practical English language-based experience in a similar position.
The Role
This part-time position involves teaching students in the primary and middle school.
Working Relationships
You will form part of a small, closely knit cohort of primary teachers in the school who work collaboratively to maximise learning opportunities for students.
The Package
In addition to a competitive salary, an accommodation allowance, relocation support, and high-quality international medical insurance is available to overseas candidates. Expressions of interest for the above position close on 31 January 2026. Should a very suitable applicant be identified before that date, the school reserves the right to make an immediate appointment. A letter of interest and introduction, a Curriculum Vitae and the names and contact details of two referees who have been closely involved with you professionally should be sent by email to: vacancies@ise.edu.ee
Please note:
The school reserves the right to appoint a suitable candidate prior to the closing date. Only candidates shortlisted for an interview will be contacted.
Further information about ISE may be found at   https://ise.edu.ee
Katre Pohlak
HR Manager

1473485.title: Assembly Operator
1473485.description:
Your next challenge:
As an Assembly Operator, you will join our Manufacturing team and play an essential part in our mission to provide the world with affordable and environment-friendly deliveries. Every day, our robots are completing thousands of autonomous deliveries in the US, UK and Europe, and were hitting records on an almost weekly basis.
NB! Please note that this role will be hired through staffing platform GoWorkaBit (no employment contract) but you will be integrated into our company culture and will work closely with our team members. You will be one of us! The salary for this position is 8.50€/hour and it is a full time role with work from Monday to Friday.

Your main responsibilities::
Building subassemblies.
Testing subassemblies.
Servicing and refurbing subassemblies.
Collaborating with engineers and team members to assure smooth operations on manufacturing site.

What's in it for you? :
Opportunity to work on industry-leading self-driving delivery robot technology on a uniquely large scale, creating history and making things happen.
You can immerse yourself in the world of technology and innovation.
You will have a chance to work with people with a strong inner burning and motivation. We are self-aware and seek feedback and improvement. We dont want to wait until we are told what needs to be done but take it as a matter of pride to figure out solutions for topics in various teams and areas.
Youll have endless opportunities to learn from our inspirational, talented team members across the globe.

What we hope you'll bring to the table: :
Previous experience with various hand tools (manual or electrical screwdrivers etc.).
Strong work ethic and ability to work at a fast pace.
Knowledge of safety regulations and procedures.
Good spoken and written communication in English.

1460971.title: Lawyer
1460971.description:
Requirements for candidates:
Masters degree in law from Estonia (preferred) or another EEA/EU university.
Full professional fluency in English required; Estonian language skills considered an advantage.
Minimum 2 years legal practice in a regulated sector, either in-house or at a law firm for example financial services, payments, fintech, banking, telecommunications, insurance, energy, or gaming.
Expertise in one or more of the following areas: payment services regulation, contract drafting and negotiation, data protection, AML/CFT, corporate governance, or intellectual property.
Ability to take responsibility for assigned legal tasks and deliver high-quality results.

Job description:
Provide legal advice and support on the companys business activities.
Draft, review, and help negotiate agreements, legal opinions, and other key documents.
Support dispute resolution, litigation, and settlement processes together with senior lawyers and external advisors.
Monitor regulatory developments, assess compliance implications, and contribute to guidance for internal stakeholders.
Take responsibility for assigned legal tasks and ensure timely, high-quality delivery.
Contribute legal input to the development of new services and products.
Coordinate the improvement of internal legal workflows, policies, and cross-functional projects.
Support corporate governance requirements and company secretarial matters.

A modern office in the center of Tallinn
Referral program

Team Events and Company Celebrations Take part in regular team-building activities and company-wide events that strengthen connections and celebrate shared success.

1474130.title: Product Manager
1474130.description:
Requirements :
5+ years of experience in product management or project leadership within fintech or tech-driven environments
Strong background in third-party vendor management and system integrations
A data-savvy mindset you dont just make decisions, you back them up
Proven ability to juggle multiple complex projects with competing priorities
Great communicator and team player you simplify the complex and work smoothly across teams and time zones
A track record of driving product innovation that enhances user experience and business impact
A degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or a related field
Proficiency in English

Job description:
Partner with the Head of Product to define a bold, clear product vision that aligns with our overall business goals and market ambitions.
Own and evolve the product roadmap. Align priorities, define milestones, and continuously refine based on insights from stakeholders, users, and the competitive landscape.
Drive end-to-end product delivery. Collaborate closely with engineering and QA to ensure timely execution and high-quality releases. Track progress, identify risks, remove blockers, and keep launches on track.
Lead the full lifecycle of third-party integrations, from vendor scouting and evaluation to onboarding, relationship management, and performance monitoring.
Work hand-in-hand with engineering, design, business, marketing, sales, and support to turn vision into action. Translate strategy into user stories and product requirements that deliver measurable value.
Stay ahead of trends in fintech and technology. Conduct market research and user interviews to uncover opportunities for new products and product enhancements.
Champion a culture of data. Use product analytics and user feedback to iterate, optimize, and make informed decisions that move the needle.
Serve as the voice of the product across the business. Communicate clearly and often, gathering requirements, aligning expectations, and advocating for impactful product development.
Our Products

demo.wallester.com
Mobile App:
wallester.com/mobile-app

Career opportunities

A chance to work as part of a highly motivated and talented team
Referral program
