2f164a76fc0b4b1d.title: Solution Analyst, Risk Management Processes, Data and Risk Operations
2f164a76fc0b4b1d.description: We are looking for a Solution Analyst to join OP Pohjola in Helsinki. The project/team, as a part of a larger architectural transformation, is acting as a spearhead in utilizing modern data and technology capabilities to develop a new credit risk model implementation framework and data products which are used for internal credit risk measurement, calculation, reporting and control in OP Pohjola. The existing, complex business environment and the development of data architecture pose significant requirements for understanding the holistic data landscape as well as designing and implementing future proof, scalable data processes. Your role in a nutshell In your role as a Solution Analyst, you play a key role in bridging business needs with technical solutions. You analyze and formalize implementation requirements, understand the workload and priorities, identify improvement opportunities and design scalable solutions. You collaborate closely with stakeholders, developers and product owners to ensure successful and timely implementation. Key responsibilities: Requirements Gathering & Analysis: Discussing with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into functional and technical requirements. Documentation & Communication: Create clear documentation including use cases, process flows, and technical specifications. Communicate effectively across teams. Solution Design: Develop solution concepts and workflows, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture and business objectives. Testing & Validation: Support QA activities by defining test cases, validating outcomes, and ensuring solutions meet acceptance criteria. Does this sound like you? Your key qualifications: Master's degree or higher in a relevant field Proven experience in business analysis or solution design within complex environments Strong understanding of software development principles and data modeling Strong capabilities in both SQL and Python Familiarity with cloud environments and knowledge of azure Proficiency in Jira and version control systems like Git Excellent problem-solving, communication, and stakeholder management skills Familiarity with Agile methodologies and CI/CD practices Understanding of banking and risk management Your soft skills: Active listening and questioning Creative and critical thinking Ability to give and receive constructive feedback Presentation skills A few words about us Our department is responsible for data related processes and operations of OP Pohjola Risk Management. You would be joining our analytics implementation team that currently has about 15 amazing professionals. The team develops data products, APIs and implements credit risk models. What we will offer you You get access to our versatile employee benefits , which include staff-based banking, insurance, and loan services. We also offer comprehensive occupational health care, extensive medical expense insurance, and full-time accident insurance. We invest in everyday balance and flexibility as well as offering you lunch, exercise, and cultural benefits and the opportunity for inexpensive vacations in OP Pohjola vacation shares. Further information and application instructions Apply for the position by sending us your CV and application through our recruitment system by Friday 12.12.2025. We would love to hear more about your skills and motivation for this role. Please also indicate your salary expectations in your application. Further information about the task and working with us is provided by Competence Lead Sanna Susiluoto, 050 305 1559 on Friday 5.12. at 10 am and on Wednesday 10.12. at 1 pm. We operate in the financial sector and our business is founded on trust and accountability. For this reason, we will check the successful candidate's credit history, corporate connections and potential conflicts of interest. In addition, the successful candidate must take a drug test and will be subject to a security clearance vetting and investigation of foreign affiliations by the Finnish Security and Intelligence Service. OP Pohjola - We have something in common Diversity and equality are highly prized at OP Pohjola. We want everyone to feel welcome and valued, and we appreciate that diversity enriches us and brings new perspectives. We invite job applications from everyone, because we all have something in common. We're thrilled that you want to join us on our shared journey. Owned by our customers, we are the most attractive financial sector employer in Finland. OP Pohjola employs more than 14,000 professionals. We have a mission - to promote the sustainable prosperity, security and wellbeing of our owner-customers and operating region. What we do matters, both to our employees and society in general. As the largest provider of financial services in Finland, we are building a better tomorrow; this has been our goal for more than 120 years.

b0f711c995825ca7.title: Analytics Lead, Asiakkuuksien ennustava Liiketoiminta-analytiikka, Pohjola Vakuutus, HKI
b0f711c995825ca7.description: Oletko kiinnostunut syventämään osaamistasi roolissa, jossa pääset rakentamaan ylivertaista asiakaskokemusta, toteuttamaan Pohjola Vakuutuksen strategiaa ja johtamaan vastuualueesi toimintaa liiketoimintatavoitteiden mukaisesti? Haemme nyt Analytics Leadia uudelle Liiketoiminta-analytiikka vastuualueelle työsuhteeseen johtamaan analytiikkatiimin toimintaa ja kehitystä. Roolissa vastaat tiekartasta, priorisoinnista ja tiimin hyvinvoinnista. Tavoitteesi on varmistaa, että tiimi tuottaa liiketoiminnalle arvoa datan ja analytiikan avulla - ilman mikromanageerausta - ja että työkuorma pysyy tasapainossa. Lisäksi johdat tiimin osaamisen kehittymistä ja urapolkuja. Tehtävästä Omistat ja ylläpidät analytiikan tiekarttaa yhdessä kollegoidesi kanssa. Muodostat selkeän suunnan tiimin kehitykselle sekä lyhyellä (0-3 kk) että pitkällä (3-18 kk) aikavälillä. Priorisoit työt yhdessä tiimin kanssa ja ylläpidät backlogia niin, että tiimi osallistuu päätöksiin ja säilyttää autonomian. Johdat ihmisiä ja osaamista sekä toimit tiimin esihenkilönä, vastaten tiimin hyvinvoinnista, kehityskeskusteluista ja osaamisen kasvusta esimerkiksi koulutusten ja mentoroinnin avulla. Huolehdit työkuorman tasapainosta ja varmistat resurssien riittävyyden, jotta ylikuormitusta ei synny. Teet tiivistä yhteistyötä liiketoiminnan ja muiden tiimien kanssa varmistaen, että analytiikkaratkaisut tuottavat arvoa. Lisäksi kehität toimintatapoja ja teknologioita parantaen prosesseja, työvälineitä ja tiimin kyvykkyyttä jatkuvan parantamisen hengessä. Millaista osaamista etsimme? Edellytämme tehtävässä kokemusta analytiikan tai datan parissa työskentelystä tiiminvetäjän, Product Ownerin, tai vastaavan roolin näkökulmasta. Sinulla on kykyä hallita tiekarttaa, priorisoida tehtäviä ja hallita laajoja kokonaisuuksia. Omaat ymmärrystä analytiikkatyökaluista, datan hallinnasta ja raportoinnista, ja sinulla on konkreettisia näyttöjä tästä aiemmissa työtehtävissä. Omaat kokemusta ihmisten johtamisesta ja osaamisen kehittämisestä, ja pidät sitä mielekkäänä osana työtäsi. Kehität systemaattisesti myös omaa osaamistasi ja yhteisiä parhaita käytäntöjä, ja koet onnistumista silloin kun tiimisi onnistuu ja pääsee sille asetettuihin tavoitteisiin. Rakennat mielelelläsi suhteita eri puolelle organisaatiota, kommunikoit ja viestit selkeästi ja halua rakentaa positiivista tiimikulttuuria. Tehtävä edellyttää työkielenä sekä suomen- että englanninkielen hyvää taitoa. Edellä mainittujen asioiden lisäksi arvostamme myös kokemusta ketteristä menetelmistä, ymmärrystä pilvipalveluista ja modernista data-arkkitehtuurista sekä kokemusta modernien koneoppimismenetelmien kehittämisestä. Me tarjoamme Vastuullisen työn vastapainoksi pidämme huolen työhyvinvoinnistasi ja tulevaisuuteen katsovista työjärjestelyistä. Tarjoamme sinulle vakaan ympäristön, jossa vastuullisuus, ihmisläheisyys ja yhdessä menestyminen ovat keskeisiä arvoja. Saat käyttöösi monipuoliset henkilöstöetumme, johon kuuluvat mm. henkilökuntaehtoiset pankki-, vakuutus- ja lainapalvelut. Tarjoamme myös kattavan työterveyshuollon, laajan hoitokuluvakuutuksen sekä täysajan tapaturmavakuutuksen. Työssäjaksamiseen panostamme arjen tasapainolla ja joustavuudella sekä tarjoamalla käyttöösi lounas-, liikunta- ja kulttuuriedut sekä mahdollisuuden edulliseen lomailuun OP Pohjolan lomaosakkeissa. Lisätiedot ja hakuohjeet Hae tehtävää lähettämällä meille CV:si ja vapaamuotoinen hakemuksesi rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta viimeistään 5.12.2025 mennessä . Kuulemme mielellämme lisää osaamisestasi ja motivaatiostasi tätä tehtävää kohtaan. Head of Customer Analytics Antti Rahtu kertoo sinulle mielellään lisää. Antin tavoitat numerosta 050 306 6946 tai sähköpostitse antti.rahtu(at)pohjola.fi. Arkipäivisin. Finanssialalla luottamus ja vastuullisuus ovat toimintamme perusta, minkä vuoksi tehtävään valittavalta henkilöltä tarkistetaan luottotiedot, yritysyhteydet ja mahdolliset eturistiriidat ja vakuutussääntelyn edellyttämä hyvämaineisuus sekä teetetään huumausainetesti. a8650d3c0405a01c.title: Vastaava työnjohtaja datakeskuksen rakennusprojektiin Vihtiin
a8650d3c0405a01c.description: Etsimme vastaavaa työnjohtajaa datakeskuksen (data center) rakennushankkeeseen Vihtiin. Työ alkaa sopimuksen mukaan, ja kyseessä on usean vuoden mittainen projekti, joten osaavalle ammattilaiselle on tarjolla pitkäaikainen työsuhde. Tehtävänkuvaus Vastaavana työnjohtajana vastaat datakeskuksen rakennustöiden toteutumisesta aikataulu-, kustannus-, laatu- ja viranomaisvaatimukset sekä asiakkaan edun huomioiden. Toimit rakennustyöntekijöiden esihenkilönä ja teet tiivistä yhteistyötä sisäisten ja ulkoisten sidosryhmien kanssa. Valvot töiden suoritusta varmistaen tehokkaat ja turvalliset työskentelytavat. Ylläpidät yksityiskohtaista dokumentaatiota ja raportoit eri vaiheiden etenemisestä. Lisäksi ratkaiset mahdolliset ongelmat ja konfliktit, jotka ilmenevät rakennusprosessin aikana. Hakijoilta odotamme: Rakennusalan korkeakoulututkintoa Useiden vuosien kokemusta rakennusalan työnjohdollisista tehtävistä Kokemusta suurista rakennusprojekteista (esim. teollisuus- tai toimistorakennukset, sairaalat, liikenneterminaalit jne.) Aiempi kokemus datakeskuksista katsotaan eduksi Tarjoamme sinulle: Mahdollisuuden työskennellä merkittävässä roolissa osana edistyksellistä teknologiahanketta. Pääset tutustumaan datakeskusten moderniin tekniikkaan kansainvälisessä edelläkävijäyrityksessä. Saat arvokasta ja ainutlaatuista kokemusta, jonka parissa pääset kehittämään osaamistasi ja ammattitaitoasi seuraavalle tasolle. Vaativasta tehtävästä maksetaan kilpailukykyinen palkkaus. Rekrytointiprosessia hoitaa Barona Engineering, mutta työsopimus allekirjoitetaan suoraan pääurakoitsijan kanssa. Lisätietoja antaa Barona Engineeringin rekrytointikonsultti Markus Korpela (050 464 8493), parhaiten tavoitettavissa torstaisin klo 13-14. Huomioithan, että WhatsApp- ja sähköpostihakemuksia ei käsitellä.

42272af0c98d4326.title: Analytics Lead, Asiakkuuksien Liiketoiminta-analytiikka, Pohjola Vakuutus, HKI
42272af0c98d4326.description: Oletko kiinnostunut syventämään osaamistasi roolissa, jossa pääset rakentamaan ylivertaista asiakaskokemusta, toteuttamaan Pohjola Vakuutuksen strategiaa ja johtamaan vastuualueesi toimintaa liiketoimintatavoitteiden mukaisesti? Haemme nyt Analytics Leadia uudelle Liiketoiminta-analytiikka vastuualueelle työsuhteeseen johtamaan analytiikkatiimin toimintaa ja kehitystä. Roolissa vastaat tiekartasta, priorisoinnista ja tiimin hyvinvoinnista. Tavoitteesi on varmistaa, että tiimi tuottaa liiketoiminnalle arvoa datan ja analytiikan avulla - ilman mikromanageerausta - ja että työkuorma pysyy tasapainossa. Lisäksi johdat tiimin osaamisen kehittymistä ja urapolkuja. Tehtävästä Omistat ja ylläpidät analytiikan tiekarttaa yhdessä kollegoidesi kanssa. Muodostat selkeän suunnan tiimin kehitykselle sekä lyhyellä (0-3 kk) että pitkällä (3-18 kk) aikavälillä. Priorisoit työt yhdessä tiimin kanssa ja ylläpidät backlogia niin, että tiimi osallistuu päätöksiin ja säilyttää autonomian. Johdat ihmisiä ja osaamista sekä toimit tiimin esihenkilönä, vastaten tiimin hyvinvoinnista, kehityskeskusteluista ja osaamisen kasvusta esimerkiksi koulutusten ja mentoroinnin avulla. Huolehdit työkuorman tasapainosta ja varmistat resurssien riittävyyden, jotta ylikuormitusta ei synny. Teet tiivistä yhteistyötä liiketoiminnan ja muiden tiimien kanssa varmistaen, että analytiikkaratkaisut tuottavat arvoa. Lisäksi kehität toimintatapoja ja teknologioita parantaen prosesseja, työvälineitä ja tiimin kyvykkyyttä jatkuvan parantamisen hengessä. Millaista osaamista etsimme? Edellytämme tehtävässä kokemusta analytiikan tai datan parissa työskentelystä tiiminvetäjän, Product Ownerin, tai vastaavan roolin näkökulmasta. Sinulla on kykyä hallita tiekarttaa, priorisoida tehtäviä ja hallita laajoja kokonaisuuksia. Omaat ymmärrystä analytiikkatyökaluista, datan hallinnasta ja raportoinnista, ja sinulla on konkreettisia näyttöjä tästä aiemmissa työtehtävissä. Omaat kokemusta ihmisten johtamisesta ja osaamisen kehittämisestä, ja pidät sitä mielekkäänä osana työtäsi. Kehität systemaattisesti myös omaa osaamistasi ja yhteisiä parhaita käytäntöjä, ja koet onnistumista silloin kun tiimisi onnistuu ja pääsee sille asetettuihin tavoitteisiin. Rakennat mielelelläsi suhteita eri puolelle organisaatiota, kommunikoit ja viestit selkeästi ja halua rakentaa positiivista tiimikulttuuria. Tehtävä edellyttää työkielenä sekä suomen- että englanninkielen hyvää taitoa. Edellä mainittujen asioiden lisäksi arvostamme myös kokemusta ketteristä menetelmistä, ymmärrystä pilvipalveluista ja modernista data-arkkitehtuurista. Me tarjoamme Vastuullisen työn vastapainoksi pidämme huolen työhyvinvoinnistasi ja tulevaisuuteen katsovista työjärjestelyistä. Tarjoamme sinulle vakaan ympäristön, jossa vastuullisuus, ihmisläheisyys ja yhdessä menestyminen ovat keskeisiä arvoja. Saat käyttöösi monipuoliset henkilöstöetumme, johon kuuluvat mm. henkilökuntaehtoiset pankki-, vakuutus- ja lainapalvelut. Tarjoamme myös kattavan työterveyshuollon, laajan hoitokuluvakuutuksen sekä täysajan tapaturmavakuutuksen. Työssäjaksamiseen panostamme arjen tasapainolla ja joustavuudella sekä tarjoamalla käyttöösi lounas-, liikunta- ja kulttuuriedut sekä mahdollisuuden edulliseen lomailuun OP Pohjolan lomaosakkeissa. Lisätiedot ja hakuohjeet Hae tehtävää lähettämällä meille CV:si ja vapaamuotoinen hakemuksesi rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta viimeistään 5.12.2025 mennessä. Kuulemme mielellämme lisää osaamisestasi ja motivaatiostasi tätä tehtävää kohtaan. Jos taas haluat kuulla lisää tehtävistä tai meillä työskentelystä, Head of Customer Analytics Antti Rahtu kertoo sinulle mielellään lisää. Antin tavoitat numerosta 050 306 6946 tai sähköpostitse antti.rahtu(at)pohjola.fi. Arkipäivisin. Finanssialalla luottamus ja vastuullisuus ovat toimintamme perusta, minkä vuoksi tehtävään valittavalta henkilöltä tarkistetaan luottotiedot, yritysyhteydet ja mahdolliset eturistiriidat ja vakuutussääntelyn edellyttämä hyvämaineisuus sekä teetetään huumausainetesti. OP Pohjola - Meillä on jotain yhteistä OP Pohjola on monimuotoisuutta ja yhdenvertaisuutta kunnioittava työyhteisö. Meille on tärkeää, että jokainen tuntee olonsa tervetulleeksi ja arvostetuksi. Arvostamme erilaisuuden mukanaan tuomaa rikkautta ja monipuolisia näkökulmia. Kannustamme kaikkia hakemaan meille töihin, sillä meillä on jotain yhteistä. Hienoa, että haluat mukaan yhteiselle matkallemme. Olemme asiakkaidemme omistama, finanssialan vetovoimaisin työnantaja Suomessa. Meillä työskentelee yli 14 000 alan ammattilaista. Perustehtävämme on edistää omistaja-asiakkaidemme ja toimintaympäristömme kestävää taloudellista menestystä, turvallisuutta ja hyvinvointia. Meillä työskentely on merkityksellistä sekä työntekijöillemme että muille, sillä Suomen suurimpana finanssitoimijana rakennamme työllämme toiveikkaampaa tulevaisuutta. Sitä olemme tehneet jo yli 120 vuoden ajan.

a8064e80a20c16cc.title: Broadband Product Manager
a8064e80a20c16cc.description: Do you want to shape the future of home connectivity and deliver world-class broadband experiences? Do you thrive in a role where product vision, customer experience, and seamless collaboration come together? We are looking for a Broadband Product Manager to join our Product Management team in the B2C Products & Offering unit. In this role, you will have ownership of broadband products and ensure that our customers enjoy the best possible experience across all channels. You'll join a team of B2C Product Managers who are not only talented in their field, but also great colleagues to work with. What you'll do: As Broadband Product Manager, your mission is to ensure our products deliver outstanding customer experience and remain competitive throughout their lifecycle. You will define and maintain the product strategy and roadmap with business stakeholders and development teams, managing the full lifecycle from launch to retirement. You will drive improvements in customer experience across all touchpoints, monitor product performance, and anticipate technology changes to keep our product portfolio future-proof. Driving development priorities, owning business requirements, and collaborating with multiple stakeholders will be key to your success. Key focus areas: Product Lifecycle: Managing the entire lifecycle of broadband products - from new launches to phase-outs. This includes understanding related technologies, anticipating changes, monitoring product quality, managing documentation, and driving cost efficiency. Product Development: Creating and maintaining development roadmaps, prioritizing initiatives, and owning business requirements for IT and development teams. Acting as Business Owner in product development projects, you'll manage change across a wide stakeholder network. Customer Experience: Leading the product experience throughout the customer journey across all channels. Using market insights and feedback, you'll develop and improve customer experience while ensuring product information is clear, accessible, and accurate. What will help you thrive in this role: You are truly curious about new technologies and passionate about turning them into consumer products. You are ready and eager to roll up your sleeves and dive into details to make things happen. You have an analytical mindset and ability to data-driven decision-making. You also have... Strong knowledge of broadband and WiFi technologies Proven experience in product management and lifecycle ownership Ability to formulate and drive broadband product vision Ability to translate business goals into technical requirements Excellent communication skills in Finnish and English and ability to work across complex stakeholder networks In addition, we appreciate: Experience with agile development, innovation, and DevOps Knowledge of process development and cost management Project management skills What Makes You Stand Out: Dare - You speak your mind and challenge ideas constructively Care - You value people around you, take ownership of your targets, and love the customer Simplify - You keep things clear and avoid unnecessary complexity Join us to shape smarter living for people, businesses, and the planet At Telia, we're a team of 15 000 colleagues across the Nordics and Baltics, passionate about technology and connectivity. As a Leading Telecommunications Operator & Climate Leader, we drive change with large-scale, impactful projects while building a sustainable, inclusive world. Here, you can grow your skills, lead meaningful projects, and thrive in a supportive, diverse environment. Whether you're taking your first step or your next, Telia is a place to grow, belong, and make a real impact. What We Offer At Telia, you will have the opportunity to make a real impact on millions of customers and shape the future of home connectivity. Join a team of skilled professionals who are passionate about creating the best customer experience. We provide a collaborative and supportive work environment, flexibility in how you work, and access to learning and development opportunities to help you thrive. Ready to make better happen? We look forward to receiving your application and to make sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. We look forward to receiving your application by 6.12.2025. Background and reference checks will be part of the process. Want to know more about this role? Please reach out to Head of Product Management Ada-Maria Wäck ada-maria.z.wack@teliacompany.com Equal opportunities At Telia, we recognize talent by professional skills and growth potential. We champion diversity, ensuring every individual's needs are met, regardless of disability, gender, age, nationality, sexual orientation, or social status. Together, we're dedicated to fostering an inclusive work environment where your uniqueness is our strength. Join us and let's make better happen - together!

8e8eaa9e53cb6eeb.title: Product Manager
8e8eaa9e53cb6eeb.description: Role Overview ONEiO is on a mission to revolutionize how integrations are delivered - turning brittle, project-based integrations into scalable, lifecycle-managed services. As Product Manager for Managed Integration Services, you will lead the definition, packaging, and enablement of ONEiO's repeatable, high-impact service offerings. This role is more than service design - it's about inspiring the organization to adopt a new operating model : Integration Ops. You'll act as the voice of this transformation internally and externally, helping teams and customers understand how we shift from fragile integration projects to resilient integration capabilities. You will own the service catalog, drive alignment across Delivery, Product, and Commercial functions, and ensure every managed service delivers measurable customer value, operational scalability, and platform-aligned execution. Key Responsibilities Service Design & Ownership Define and maintain a portfolio of Managed Integration Services , such as onboarding, monitoring, change handling, and support escalation Establish SLAs, scope definitions, roles, and pricing models aligned to customer outcomes and internal delivery capabilities. Drive consistency and repeatability through templates, playbooks, and operational patterns. Product Management & Roadmap Own and evolve parts of the ONEiO SaaS platform roadmap that intersect with managed services - such as automation tooling, configuration UX, and observability features. Collaborate with Engineering and Platform teams to prioritize and define requirements for product enhancements that enable better service delivery and customer experience. Bring a holistic product management mindset - balancing internal operational needs, external customer demands, and strategic platform evolution. Go-to-Market & Cross-Team Leadership Translate technical capabilities into clear, compelling offerings with aligned messaging, documentation, and internal enablement. Inspire internal teams - from engineers to sales - around the opportunity Integration Ops brings to ONEiO's customers and the market. Act as a product marketing partner to commercial teams by creating value propositions, FAQs, collateral, and training content. Lifecycle & Operational Excellence Act as the lifecycle owner for all managed services - ensuring continuous improvement based on customer feedback, delivery metrics, and commercial insights. Collaborate with Delivery and Platform teams to automate lifecycle work , reduce variance, and increase reusability. Track and improve service-level KPIs like onboarding time, configuration reusability, MTTR, and cost-per-integration. What We're Looking For 4-7 years of experience in product management, product marketing, service design , or a related cross-functional role. Demonstrated ability to design, own, and iterate on repeatable service offerings - ideally in a platform, SaaS, or IT services context. Clear understanding of Integration, iPaaS, or DevOps landscapes; knowledge of Integration Ops is a major plus. A compelling communicator who can rally diverse stakeholders around a common vision and inspire action. Strong documentation, prioritization, and product lifecycle skills; able to switch between strategic narratives and operational detail. Embodies ONEiO's iONEER mindset - takes ownership, starts with the customer, inspires others, and delivers results . Why ONEiO Revolutionize an industry : Play a key role in reshaping how integrations are delivered across global service ecosystems. Inspire and lead change : Drive not just internal clarity, but a mindset shift in how our customers view and consume integrations. Work with forward thinkers : Be part of a team that combines platform engineering, automation, and service design to scale outcomes. Grow with purpose : Contribute to ONEiO's global growth and help build a culture of empowerment, ownership, and creativity.

9dcf3a2cd2421cfb.title: Product Manager B2B
9dcf3a2cd2421cfb.description: We're looking for a Product Manager, B2B to lead the development of Singa's business-to-business products and shape the future of how venues and hospitality partners deliver karaoke experiences worldwide. You'll take full ownership of the B2B product area, driving strategy, discovery, prioritization, and delivery from start to finish. The goal is to build products that delight users and become indispensable to our customers' businesses, while maintaining a healthy balance between speed, quality, and long-term scalability. This is a key role in Singa's product organization, as the team evolves into dedicated sub-teams focused on different business areas. You'll lead the B2B product stream - ensuring its roadmap delivers measurable business impact, customer satisfaction, and growth. You'll collaborate closely with engineering, design, sales, customer success, and data to align priorities, streamline delivery, and continuously improve how we plan, build, and measure our products. What Success Looks Like The B2B roadmap is clear, data-driven, and tied to customer and business outcomes. Product delivery runs on schedule with strong alignment and focus across teams. Features launch successfully, adoption grows, and customer satisfaction increases. The product team operates efficiently, with fewer ad-hoc fixes and higher release quality. You'll be expected to challenge assumptions, connect commercial goals with technical reality, and continuously improve how we plan, build, and measure our products.  You stay calm under pressure and make clear, informed decisions when priorities compete. What You'll Be Doing Owning the B2B product roadmap - defining, prioritising, and communicating upcoming initiatives based on customer and business needs Driving product delivery - ensuring features ship on schedule and with high quality, documented accordingly Improving Product KPIs (cycle time, release frequency, crash-free rates) and both customer and user satisfaction Ensuring cross-team alignment - making priorities, trade-offs, and goals visible and understood Leading discovery and validation - gathering insights from users, and data to get insight on what to build next Monitoring outcomes - measure post-release impact and adjust roadmap accordingly Challenging roadmaps and technical decisions - ensuring every product investment is tied to a measurable business impact You'll combine an entrepreneurial and data-informed mindset with strong attention to detail - translating metrics into clear insights, leading experiments for further learnings and always acting if encountering UX requiring attention What We're Looking For Must Have Proven experience managing end-to-end product development cycles, preferably in a B2B environment Strong ability to translate business objectives and customer needs into clear product priorities and roadmaps People skills - demonstrated success in leading cross-functional teams (engineering, design, data) and ensuring alignment and focus Competence in interpreting product and user data to guide decision-making and measure impact Proficient in balancing business outcomes with technical realities - enough technical skills to challenge opinions for successful trade-off and tech-debt management An eye for and understanding of good UI/UX design Solid communication skills Ownership-driven: takes full responsibility for outcomes (not just outputs) Empathic and curious about both customer and user needs Nice to Have Technical prototyping experience (basic HTML/CSS/JS and/or low-code tools for rapid validation) UX design experience (wireframing, user flows) Deeper understanding of technical architecture and APIs Experience in establishing and/or improving product KPIs Experience with music, entertainment, or hospitality technology products Exposure to international B2B markets and customer success processes About Singa Singa is transforming the global karaoke industry with a modern streaming platform that serves over 2 million users and 1,600 venues across 34 countries. With 100,000+ licensed songs, including original artist recordings through partnerships with major labels like Warner Music Group, we're building the digital future of karaoke. Our Work Model Hybrid: In the Helsinki Capital Region, we aim a hybrid setup with 2-3 remote days per week. For those living outside the capital region, we typically aim for around five office days per month. Our Commitment to Diversity We're building a team that reflects the diversity of the European developer and creative community. We evaluate candidates based on skills, not pedigree or career path. We provide interview accommodations for candidates who need them, and our collaborative culture ensures technical and product decisions are inclusive and transparent. Don't meet every requirement? Research shows underrepresented groups often apply only when they meet 100% of qualifications. If you're excited about building world-class products and leading cross-functional collaboration - we encourage you to apply. How to Apply If this sounds like you, come join us in spreading the joy of singing! Please send your resume and complete the application form. We review applications weekly during the application period and will fill the role as soon as we find the right person - so we encourage you to apply quickly. Our recruitment process includes interviews and a take-home assignment.

a5a017d2dedf27a1.title: Product Manager B2C
a5a017d2dedf27a1.description: We're looking for a Product Manager, B2C to lead the development of Singa's consumer products and ensure our B2C product development moves in the right direction without compromising quality. You'll take full ownership of the B2C product area, driving strategy, discovery, prioritization, and delivery from start to finish. The goal is to build products our users love to sing with, while understanding and managing the balance of acceptable technical debt. You bring empathy for users and curiosity for what truly makes our products meaningful. This is a key role in Singa's product organization, as the team is being restructured into dedicated sub-teams focused on business areas: B2B, B2C, and internal. You'll lead the B2C product stream ensuring its roadmap delivers measurable business impact, user satisfaction and retention. Your work will directly contribute to Singa's B2C business growth by increasing sales, user satisfaction, and long-term engagement. You'll collaborate closely with engineering, design, marketing, customer support, and data teams to align priorities, streamline delivery, and ensure that product decisions always serve both our users and the business effectively. What Success Looks Like The B2C roadmap is clear, data-driven, and moving in the right direction without compromising quality. Product delivery stays on schedule with strong alignment and focus across teams. Features launch successfully, user satisfaction and retention increase, and business growth follows. The product team operates efficiently with fewer ad-hoc maintenance tasks and higher release quality. You'll be expected to challenge assumptions and priorities when needed, connect commercial goals with technical reality, and continuously improve how we plan, build, and measure our products. You stay calm under pressure and make clear, informed decisions when priorities compete. What You'll Be Doing As Product Manager for B2C, your main responsibilities include: Owning the B2C product roadmap - defining, prioritizing, and communicating upcoming initiatives based on user and business needs. Driving product delivery - ensuring features ship on schedule and with high quality, documented accordingly. Leading discovery and validation - gathering insights from users and data to identify what to build next. Improving product KPIs - focusing on cycle time, release frequency, crash-free rates, and user satisfaction. Ensuring cross-team alignment - making priorities, trade-offs, and goals visible and understood. Monitoring outcomes post-release - measuring impact and adjusting roadmap accordingly. Challenging roadmaps and technical decisions - ensuring every product investment is tied to a measurable business impact. You'll combine an entrepreneurial and data-informed mindset with strong attention to detail - turning metrics into insight, leading experiments to learn fast, and acting quickly when you notice UX that needs improvement What We're Looking For Must Have Proven experience managing end-to-end product development cycles, preferably in a B2C environment Strong ability to translate business objectives and user needs into clear product priorities and roadmaps People skills - demonstrated success in leading cross-functional teams (engineering, design, data) and ensuring alignment and focus Competence in interpreting product and user data to guide decision-making and measure impact Proficient in balancing business outcomes with technical realities - enough technical skills to challenge opinions for successful trade-offs and tech-debt management An eye for and understanding of good UI/UX design Solid communication skills Ownership-driven: takes full responsibility for outcomes (not just outputs) Analytical mind with attention to detail Entrepreneurial approach: proactively identifies new growth opportunities Nice to Have Technical prototyping experience (basic HTML/CSS/JS and/or low-code tools for rapid validation) UX design experience (wireframing, user flows) Deeper understanding of technical architecture and APIs Experience in establishing and/or improving product KPIs Experience with music, entertainment, or hospitality technology products Exposure to international B2C markets and customer support processes About Singa Singa is transforming the global karaoke industry with a modern streaming platform that serves over 2 million users and 1,600 venues across 34 countries. With 100,000+ licensed songs, including original artist recordings through partnerships with major labels like Warner Music Group, we're building the digital future of karaoke. Our Work Model Hybrid: In the Helsinki Capital Region, we aim a hybrid setup with 2-3 remote days per week. For those living outside the capital region, we typically aim for around five office days per month. Our Commitment to Diversity We're building a team that reflects the diversity of the European developer and creative community. We evaluate candidates based on skills, not pedigree or career path. We provide interview accommodations for candidates who need them, and our collaborative culture ensures technical and product decisions are inclusive and transparent. Don't meet every requirement? Research shows underrepresented groups often apply only when they meet 100% of qualifications. If you're excited about building world-class products and leading cross-functional collaboration - we encourage you to apply. How to Apply If this sounds like you, come join us in spreading the joy of singing! Please send your resume and complete the application form. We review applications weekly during the application period and will fill the role as soon as we find the right person - so we encourage you to apply quickly. Our recruitment process includes interviews and a take-home assignment.

f68486e7e8302ca8.title: Technical Product Manager
f68486e7e8302ca8.description: The Impact You'll Make At Danfoss Drives, we're driving the transformation toward a smarter, safer, and more energy-efficient future. As our new Technical Product Manager, Cybersecurity, you'll play a key role in protecting the technology that powers sustainable industry - ensuring our electrical motor drives meet the highest global cybersecurity standards You'll help shape how cybersecurity comes to life in our products - from design to certification - giving customers the confidence that their automation systems are secure and future-ready. This is your opportunity to make a tangible impact at the intersection of innovation, compliance, and safety Join a team that values collaboration, continuous learning, and doing work that truly matters. Together, we'll set new benchmarks for cybersecurity in industrial automation Position is located: Vaasa, Tampere or Helsinki What You'll Be Doing Lead and manage cybersecurity certification activities (IEC62443-4) for our drive products, working closely with skilled development and compliance teams. Collaborate with internal R&D, product management, and customers to align on cybersecurity goals and deliver trusted, compliant solutions. Guide documentation and validation processes that demonstrate compliance throughout the product lifecycle. Supervise and maintain security lifecycle activities, ensuring consistent, evidence-based certification outcomes. Support continuous improvement by sharing best practices and identifying opportunities to enhance security processes. What We're Looking For Proven experience in embedded device cybersecurity development and certification. Hands-on knowledge of the IEC62443-4 cybersecurity certification process - including document management, audits, and implementation. Degree (B.Sc. or M.Sc.) in computer science, automation, or a related engineering field. Structured, self-driven mindset with strong communication and stakeholder management skills. Experience in functional safety (IEC61508) or electrical motor drives is an advantage. Join Danfoss Drives and become part of a team making a significant impact in energy efficiency and electrification. As a global leader in power conversion solutions, we are committed to sustainability, exceptional quality, and fostering an inclusive work environment. Our technology powers industries worldwide and supports global decarbonization efforts. Engineer a better future with Danfoss, where meaningful change begins with you! What You'll Get from Us We promote from within and support your learning with mentoring, training, and access to global opportunities. You'll have flexibility, autonomy, and support to do your best work while maintaining a healthy work-life balance. Your well-being matters to us. We strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are respected, and valued for who they are. Ready to Make a Difference? If this role excites you, we'd love to hear from you! Apply now to start the conversation and learn more about where your career can go with us. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category. Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification. Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities. Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 39.000 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories. Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification. Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities. Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 39.360 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories.

28b1641b0b962c45.title: Senior Product Manager - Games
28b1641b0b962c45.description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 300 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Next Games, founded in 2013 and based in Helsinki, Finland, crafts cutting-edge, approachable games for a global audience inspired by popular Netflix shows and movies and our own fresh ideas. We combine the Finnish game development culture with Netflix's global entertainment culture, embracing the strengths of both and empowering our talented and diverse teams to do the best work of their careers. The Role As a Senior Product Manager , you will be responsible for the business viability of games, throughout their lifecycle. You will get to work on Next Games' new games initiatives, working hands-on within the game team to create, launch, and operate innovative new games under a subscription-based business model. As part of this pioneering initiative, your contribution is in a unique position to create value for Netflix members and make an impact within Netflix. Essential Functions/Responsibilities Collaborate with the Game Director to strengthen the Product Vision with a matching Product Strategy, Go-to-market plan, and Live Operations plan Set and uphold game-specific KPIs, performance targets, and business viability constraints that drive Netflix objectives. Be the champion for your games' performance, learnings, opportunities, and business impact within the game studio. Collaborate with designers, engineers, UX, and artists to plan and deliver high-impact features, systems, economies, content, and live operations. Collaborate with data analysts on defining and validating our product hypotheses, and creating plans for telemetry, product analysis, and experimentation. Collaborate with Marketing, UA, and Product Discovery to drive growth Focus the efforts of the game team by evaluating and prioritizing player needs and opportunities with impactful tactics and solutions. Work with Netflix stakeholders and studio leadership to ensure clarity and alignment on roadmaps and product requirements, performance, objectives, and expectations. Work with internal Netflix partners to ensure your game is built for success within and leveraging the Netflix ecosystem. Skills and Abilities You're a strategic thinker with a passion for games, equipped with a healthy blend of technical knowledge, a customer-focused mindset, and strong instincts for an outstanding customer experience. You have a deep understanding of the games market and trends (mobile, console, PC), and top-performing products, and familiarity with commonly applied strategies and tactics for acquisition, engagement, and retention. You have the ability to inspire, motivate and lead a cross-functional team: Your ability to build strong relationships is critical to success. You are proficient and self-sufficient in using data to analyse game performance, inform priorities, and evaluate opportunities. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, our working language. You are proficient with common software development, communication, and virtual collaboration tools to be effective within the team (eg. Jira, Slack, Notion, Miro, Figma, Google suite, LLMs / GenAI tools) Experience Hands-on Product management experience with multiple games, a proven record of successfully launching products and/or running successful live-operated games. Experienced in player-centric approaches to defining the target audiences and evaluating their needs and motivations. Expertise in game design for engagement and retention Experienced in using player research and experimentation methods such as AB-testing to validate hypotheses. Experienced in high-stakes executive presentations and stakeholder management. We aim high here at Next Games and will ask you to do the same. In exchange, you'll be part of a team that is great to work with, who is dedicated and passionate about what we do. Our guiding light in growing our team is that we don't look for a culture fit - we look for what each person brings to our collective skillset, culture and values to make them richer. Will you be the person to make us better? Apply now. Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

ef7b8b2c97e32134.title: Sales Manager - Product Specialist focus
ef7b8b2c97e32134.description: Company Description Topcon Healthcare sees eye health differently. Our vision is to empower providers with smart and efficient technologies for enhanced patient care. Keeping pace with the ever-changing landscape of the healthcare industry, we offer the latest integrated solutions including advanced multimodal imaging, vendor-neutral data management and groundbreaking remote diagnostic technology. By investing in value-driven innovations, Topcon works to enable people to enjoy good health and a high quality of life. Job Description We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Sales Manager - Product Specialist to drive commercial growth and represent our world-class ophthalmic and diagnostic product portfolio across Norway or Finland. This senior professional will play a dual role: combining strategic sales leadership with in-depth product expertise, strengthening Topcon's position as a trusted partner to healthcare professionals and institutions. What You'll Do As Sales Manager / Product Specialist, you will take full ownership of your territory's commercial success. You will manage the entire sales cycle: from identifying new opportunities and nurturing key accounts, to closing deals and ensuring customer satisfaction. In parallel, you will act as a product specialist, delivering clinical and technical insight that empowers customers to make confident investment decisions. Your responsibilities will include: Developing and executing a territory business plan that drives growth and achieves sales and margin targets. Identifying and securing new business opportunities across hospitals, clinics, and optometry practices. Building and maintaining long-term customer relationships through regular meetings, demonstrations, and consultations. Acting as the product expert , delivering presentations, demonstrations, and post-sale support for Topcon's ophthalmic portfolio. Collaborating with marketing, service, and product management teams to deliver integrated customer solutions. Representing Topcon at major national and international trade fairs, exhibitions, and professional events. Preparing accurate forecasts, reports, and market insights, ensuring CRM and pipeline data are kept up to date. Monitoring competitor activity and market trends, contributing to the regional commercial strategy. Who You Are You are a strategic, customer-focused, and results-driven sales professional with a strong technical mindset and genuine passion for the ophthalmic and diagnostic equipment sector. You thrive on building relationships and translating technical excellence into commercial success. You will: Demonstrate a proactive, entrepreneurial approach to territory management and business growth. Communicate persuasively with technical and non-technical audiences. Build trust and credibility with healthcare professionals, decision-makers, and partners. Show resilience, determination, and adaptability in complex or competitive sales environments. Balance strategic vision with hands-on sales execution and customer engagement. Collaborate effectively across cross-functional teams to ensure a seamless customer experience. Represent Topcon with professionalism, confidence, and integrity at all times. Act as a product ambassador, translating complex technology into clear, value-driven solutions. Qualifications A bachelor's degree in business, engineering, life sciences, optometry, or a related technical discipline - or equivalent experience in B2B medical/ophthalmic sales. 5-10+ years' proven sales experience in medical devices, ophthalmic equipment, diagnostic instruments, or a similar technical sales environment. Demonstrated success in meeting or exceeding sales targets and managing full sales cycles. Strong understanding of clinical workflows, ophthalmic diagnostics, and market trends. Experience presenting at trade fairs, exhibitions, or professional conferences. Solid CRM and digital tool proficiency; capable of managing pipelines, data, and forecasts effectively. Valid driver's license and willingness to travel nationally and internationally as needed. Fluency in English (written and spoken). Additional Information Videos To Watch

a99a96ba99aa1de7.title: Product Marketing Manager, Red's Club
a99a96ba99aa1de7.description: Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here . Are you enthusiastic about connecting players with exceptional loyalty experiences? We're looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join our Direct to Consumer team in Espoo! At its core, Red's Club is a key strategic initiative designed to deepen player engagement and loyalty across our games and drive sales in the Red's Club webshop. Red's Club is live and at a scale where you have the potential to start driving significant business impact from day one. You'll play a central role in shaping how players discover and experience Red's Club, both within our games and across our digital touchpoints like website and email. You'll help us build the foundation for how we market, measure, and continuously improve these player engagement initiatives. You'll collaborate closely with game teams, data and analytics, and creative teams to ensure our marketing is data-informed and scalable. This position is based in Espoo, Finland, and follows a hybrid work model with 2 on-site days per week. You will have impact and fun at work by: Collaborating with game teams to design integrated Red's Club marketing concepts and in-game activations that genuinely connect with the player journey. Developing, testing, and iterating on our email marketing concepts, focusing on user journeys, segmentation and clear impact tracking. Coordinating the production of engaging creative assets and content across multiple channels (in-game, email, website). Partnering with our analytics teams to define clear KPIs and success metrics, helping us evaluate impact on areas like engagement, conversion, and retention. Building and maintaining essential marketing measurement frameworks, dashboards, and post-campaign reports to drive informed decisions. Gathering deep insights from player feedback, campaign data, and competitor benchmarking to identify and translate opportunities into actionable recommendations. Creating and maintaining clear, shareable internal guidance and playbooks that help our Red's Club marketing continuously evolve. Experience and skills we are looking for: You have demonstrated experience in product marketing, CRM, or growth marketing, ideally within games, entertainment, or digital products. You have a solid understanding of core product marketing principles, including segmentation, positioning, and lifecycle marketing. You can demonstrate your ability to plan, execute, and measure marketing campaigns across channels like in-game, email, and web. You are comfortable working with structured data, metrics, and marketing tools (e.g., CRM, analytics, or automation platforms). You possess excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with experience presenting data-driven insights to stakeholders. It would be nice if you also have the following skills: You have experience working within the gaming, mobile, or ecommerce industry. You're familiar with player engagement and retention strategies in gaming or digital ecosystems. You have experience setting up campaign tracking, A/B testing, or reporting workflows. Please send your CV in English. We look forward to speaking to you! We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name. At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or conditions in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at [email protected] . What to expect when you join us Meet the Rovians Hiring process at Rovio Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Rovio

0f3b82e0746c2180.title: Project Manager, New Product Introduction
0f3b82e0746c2180.description: Job Description Summary GE Healthcare, a leading global health technology provider, has strong presence in Helsinki. In the Vallila district, we are 700+ people from 32 countries, helping healthcare providers improve patient care. We are looking for a passionate Project Manager with good experience and passion of leading product development projects from design to manufacturing. You will lead and support cross-functional teams in developing and releasing our next generation patient monitoring products and systems. Job Description Roles and Responsibilities Lead a cross-functional product development team from design phase to product manufacturing, ensuring that the program meets quality, regulatory, customer and business needs, in close collaboration with Program Manager and other stakeholders. Manage cross-functional dependencies to maximize team's efficiency and avoid gaps/delays in execution. Support, motivate and lead the team through various challenges. Facilitate team activities in finding efficient ways of mitigating program risks. Create and maintain program development plans/schedules and represent the team to the upper management with program metrics and reports. Interact seamlessly and efficiently in a cross-functional, multi-cultural, global environment. Required Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Technology. Experience in project management of developing complex engineering products including software and hardware through the whole product development life cycle. Solid technical know-how to work with patient monitor technologies (electronics, mechanics, embedded SW, wireless, cybersecurity, materials, standards, testing, manufacturing). Self-starter, quick learner with demonstrated engineering curiosity and problem-solving skills. Ability to produce good, concise technical documentation and detailed project plans. Strong communication skills. Fluent in English, both written and oral. Legally authorized to work in Finland and willing to work in our Helsinki office full-time. Desired Characteristics Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Technology. Leading product development experience in highly regulated businesses (like medical). Experience with HW development, manufacturing and suppliers management, Agile SW development, standards requirements and compliance testing, regulatory submissions. Experience in leading teams and projects, facilitating teams' activities and driving to decisions and conclusions. Experience in starting and leading change improvements initiatives. What We Offer Work for a great purpose - your work will save people's lives! Great opportunity to learn and develop leading edge technologies. Pair work with and learn from world's best experts in the industry. Grow your technical know-how, skills, and abilities to support future roles in the organization. Work in a diverse multicultural environment. Flexible working hours scheme in a hybrid mode (remote and in the office). Office near Pasila railway station in central Helsinki with own on-site parking, gym, great café, and lunch restaurant. Competitive compensation package. Inclusion and Diversity GE HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Behaviours We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership - always with unyielding integrity. Total Rewards Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you'd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you'll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration, and support. #LI-KP3 Additional Information Relocation Assistance Provided: No

106f2e502132dda6.title: Motion global IS Service Manager for R&D, engineering and product management
106f2e502132dda6.description: At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world. This Position respons to: IS Domain Lead-R&D,Engineering&Pro Mgmt ABB Motion, a global leader in motors and drives, is at the core of accelerating a more productive and sustainable future. We innovate and push the boundaries of technology to contribute to energy efficient,   decarbonizing   and circular solutions for customers,   industries,   and societies. With our digitally enabled drives,   m otors   and   s ervices   we support our customers and partners to achieve better performance,   s afety   and reliability. To help the world's industries outrun - leaner and cleaner, we deliver motor-driven solutions for a wide range of applications in all industrial segments. Building on over 140 years   o f domain   e xpertise   in electric   p owertrains ,   our more than   2 2,000 employees   across 100 countries learn and improve every day.   g o.abb / motion This role is open   globally,   but location s are set in one of our major ABB Motion locations,   eg.   in   Finland, Poland,   India , Italy,   Germany   or Spain . The work model   is hybrid   #LI-hybrid   and working under European time zone will be expected. As IS Service Manager   for R&D,   engineering   and product management , you are accountable for all measures that support the applications falling within the scope of Motion IS   PLM   Domain. Major focus would be on Application Management of PLM,   CAD   and integrated Platforms with   functional management of Support Teams to deliver IS application Services meeting the demand generated by the   Domain at agreed SLAs with Business. The IS Service Manager   is responsible for   overseeing all activities related to the applications within the Motion IS PLM   Domain. This role focuses on managing PLM, CAD, and integrated platforms, ensuring the effective delivery of IS   application services that meet the domain's demands and agreed-upon SLAs. Key Responsibilities Deliver and   maintain   IS solutions within the assigned domain, ensuring alignment with business needs and compliance standards. Manage cloud infrastructure and   PLM   applications , focusing on performance, security, and cost optimization. Oversee end-to-end service delivery , including project management, testing, training, user support, and quality assurance. Ensure compliance and security through regular audits, adherence to ABB policies, and proactive risk management. Lead application lifecycle management , including deployments, hosting, incident handling, and service desk coordination. Drive continuous improvement in service delivery processes, asset management, and license/infrastructure cost efficiency. Support strategic planning and budgeting , collaborating with stakeholders on roadmaps, RFPs, and cost forecasting. Build and lead high-performing teams , ensuring skills development, resource planning, and alignment with service levels. Ensure   alignment of application with business strategy and needs. Define and   monitor   the Service Level Agreement (SLA) for the applications in agreement with business requirements and application delivery organization. Qu alifications A minimu m   of   7+   years   of relevant  experience working on PLM/CAD or other Engineering Applications A prior experience in leading IS team (s)   is mandatory Excellent IS developing and operations skills, deep understanding of the overall context of business processes &   technologies Experience of   identifying   and resolving issues between team members or other teams Capacity   to translate business requirements into technical IS capabilities and solutions Relevant experience in project planning and execution as well as economic aspects of system management and life cycle Sound knowledge of ITIL processes   &   v ery good   knowledge of IS Infrastructure (Cloud Hosting) Strong in information management, computer systems, business   engineering   or similar fiel d #ABBCareers #RunwithABB #Runwhatrunstheworld We value people from   different backgrounds . Could this be your story? Apply today or visit   careers.abb   to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. Arvostamme eri taustoista tulevia ihmisiä. Voisiko tämä olla sinun tarinasi? Hae jo tänään tai vieraile osoitteessa www.abb.com lukeaksesi lisää meistä ja saadaksesi tietoa ratkaisujemme vaikutuksesta ympäri maailmaa.

8b761c54dd5c252c.title: Finance System Solution Analyst
8b761c54dd5c252c.description: Aalto University is where science and art meet technology and business. We shape a sustainable future by making research breakthroughs in and across our disciplines, sparking the game changers of tomorrow and creating novel solutions to major global challenges. Our community is made up of 120 nationalities, 14 000 students, 400 professors and close to 5000 faculty and staff working on our dynamic campus in Espoo, Greater Helsinki, Finland. Diversity is part of who we are, and we actively work to ensure our community's diversity and inclusiveness. This is why we warmly encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to join our community. Aalto Finance Services supports the university in its core actions by ensuring financial sustainability in the long term, providing professional support for academic units and ensuring compliance. The Process & System Support team develops and supports all of Aalto's Financial Systems and their users. We are looking for a Finance System Solution Analyst to design, develop, and support Aalto University's financial processes and systems. Your role and goals As a Finance System Solution Analyst, you will help ensure that our finance systems meet the needs of the organization while maintaining stability and efficiency. You will collaborate closely with Finance users, Finance Management, Aalto Schools, Support Functions, and external system and service providers. Your work will cover systems and processes related to Accounting, Planning, Payments, Banking, and other Finance operations. You will report to the Manager of the Finance Process and Systems Support team. Main responsibilities System support and maintenance Handle and resolve support tickets (incidents, problems, questions) from Aalto users Manage and follow up on support requests with system vendors Take initiative to improve system usability and user satisfaction Manage and regularly review system access rights Perform system administration tasks for time-critical Finance operations (e.g. month-end and year-end closing) Carry out system maintenance tasks such as housekeeping, regular updates, and data integrity checks Keep system configuration and documentation up to date Development and improvement Identify and prepare system development needs for approval Manage and follow up on approved developments and testing Participate in user training and maintain training materials Represent the Finance organization in university-wide development projects when needed Vendor management Participate in regular operational meetings with vendors Prepare and present summaries of vendor performance (e.g. ticket statistics, service levels) What we expect from you You are proactive, development-oriented, and comfortable working both independently and with diverse stakeholders. You communicate clearly and approach problem-solving analytically. We expect experience with modern ERP (cloud) systems, in particular Oracle Fusion Cloud experience with Projects (PPM) and Finance (GA) modules several years of experience with Financial systems and/or ERP Finance development projects either in consulting, corporate development or public sector working background in operational Finance / Financial Management functions or equivalent experience strong analytical and problem-solving skills working proficiency in both Finnish and English higher education degree in e.g.  Finance, Business Administration, or related field Ambition to grow and willingness to take on additional responsibilities, for example (substitute) managerial tasks and larger developments What we offer With the deployment of the new Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP financial system, there is a significant need to support the adaptation of the new system and to improve processes across the whole university. You'll have a unique opportunity to contribute and make your mark You will be working together with our small team in common financial services as a part of the Process & System support team. Our team has a good mix of Financial and System knowledge to find the right solutions based on needs and system capabilities. Meaningful and inspiring work environment. We are proud of our purpose to shape a sustainable future. We spark the game changers of tomorrow, and renew society with research-based knowledge, creativity and an entrepreneurial mindset. Responsible and meaningful role with true impact in our University's success, and in the end, in the wellbeing and development of our society. Support, coaching and sparring when you feel you need it. Great possibilities for competence development and learning. We constantly keep learning to find the most impactful ways to empower - and invest in - our people. The salary range for this position is approximately 4500 - 5000 €/month. We value work-life balance and well-being in all aspects of life. We work in a hybrid model, with the primary workplace located at the Otaniemi Campus in Espoo. Life on the revitalized campus is vibrant, featuring stunning architecture, tranquil nature, and a variety of cafes, restaurants, and services, all complemented by excellent public transportation connections. Join us! To apply, please share your CV and motivation letter with us through our recruitment site ("Apply now!") latest at 23.59pm (EET) 7th December 2025. Please note: Aalto University's employees should apply for the position via our internal HR system Workday (Internal Jobs) by using their existing Workday user account (not via the external webpage for open positions). For more information about the role, please contact Marc Habets +358 50 4403040 on 21.11, 28.11. or 5.12. between 11:00-12:00 EET.  For questions related to the application process, please contact HR Partner Isabella Itäpalo via email isabella.itapalo(at)aalto.fi. You will hear from us the latest in the 2nd week of December. We aim to have a transparent and equal recruitment process, so feel free to ask us for feedback. More about Aalto University: Aalto.fi youtube.com/user/aaltouniversity linkedin.com/school/aalto-university/ www.facebook.com/aaltouniversity instagram.com/aaltouniversity To view information about Workday Accessibility, please click here . Please see more of our Open Positions here.

f555f11cd9b844dc.title: Service Delivery Manager, pankkitoimiala
f555f11cd9b844dc.description: Position Description: CGI on yksi suurimmista IT- ja liiketoimintakonsultoinnin yrityksistä Suomessa ja maailmalla. Vahva kokemuksemme eri toimialoilta auttaa julkisen ja yksityisen sektorin asiakkaitamme onnistumaan digitaalisessa muutoksessa ja saavuttamaan tavoitteitaan entistä tehokkaammin. Service Delivery Manager - pankkitoimiala Haluatko olla mukana kehittämässä tulevaisuuden myynnin työkaluja ja palveluita? Etsimme kokenutta Service Delivery Manageria, joka vastaa pankkitoimialan myynnin työkalujen ja palveluiden kehityksestä, ylläpidosta ja jatkuvasta parantamisesta. Tässä roolissa olet avainasemassa varmistamassa, että ratkaisut tuottavat todellista arvoa myyjille, asiakaskohtaamisiin ja koko pankin asiakaskokemukseen. Roolisi ja tehtäväsi Service Delivery Managerina johdat palvelutoimitusta yhdessä osaavan tiimimme kanssa. Työsi on monipuolinen yhdistelmä ihmisten johtamista, kehitystyön koordinointia ja yhteistyötä eri sidosryhmien - IT:n, liiketoiminnan ja ulkoisten kumppaneiden - kanssa. Arjessasi vastaat mm. seuraavista: • IT-palveluiden ja sovellusten kehityksen ja hallinnan kokonaisuudesta • kehitystyön priorisoinnista ja etenemisen seurannasta • palveluiden jatkuvasta parantamisesta ja laadun varmistamisesta • tiiviistä yhteistyöstä liiketoiminnan, teknologian ja toimittajien kanssa Tuleva tiimisi Pääset osaksi pankkitoimialan asiakkuuksiin keskittyvää tiimiä, joka vastaa myynnin työkalujen ja palveluiden kehittämisestä. Toimimme ketterässä ja kansainvälisessä ympäristössä, jossa tiimit tukevat toisiaan yli toiminnallisten rajojen. Työskentelemme joustavasti hybridimallissa yhdistäen etä- ja lähityön parhaat puolet. Edellytämme sinulta • Kokemusta IT-palveluiden tai sovellusten kehittämisestä ja/tai hallinnasta pankki- tai rahoitussektorilla (erityisesti in-house-ympäristössä) • Syvällistä ymmärrystä pankin back office -prosessien ja myynnin työkalujen vuorovaikutuksesta • ITIL-osaamista ja mieluiten ITIL 4.0 -sertifikaattia • Kokemusta projektinhallinnasta ja taloudellisesta raportoinnista • Ketterien menetelmien ja jatkuvan palvelun parantamisen tuntemusta • Erinomaista yhteistyö- ja viestintäkykyä sekä kykyä toimia luotettavana kumppanina eri sidosryhmille • Sujuvaa suomen ja englannin kielen taitoa sekä kokemusta kansainvälisestä työympäristöstä Tarjoamme sinulle Tiedämme, että onnistuminen perustuu ihmisiin ja kulttuuriin, toimivia työkaluja ja teknologiaa unohtamatta. CGI:llä saat luoda juuri sinulle sopivaa urapolkua mielenkiintoisten tehtävien sekä sisäisen urakierron kautta. Voit myös jatkuvasti kehittää taitojasi ja syventää osaamistasi mm. CGI Academian avulla. Tarjoamme sinulle työn, jossa voit kehittyä haluamaasi suuntaan sekä mahdollisuuden omistaa yhtiön osakkeita ainutlaatuisen osakesäästöohjelmamme avulla. Henkilöstöstämme 85 % on osakkeenomistajia ja siksi olemmekin CGI Partnereita. Meillä työ joustaa, kun elämäntilanteesi sitä vaatii. Pidämme huolta sinusta ja hyvinvoinnistasi monipuolisin henkilöstöeduin ja tarjoamme mm. kattavan työterveyshuollon, vapaa-ajan vakuutuksen, sairaan lapsen hoitopalvelun sekä mahdollisuuden työsuhdepolkupyörään. Osallistumalla CGI:n hyvinvointiyhteisöjen toimintaan pääset myös tutustumaan työkavereihin eri puolilta taloa yhteisten harrastusten parissa. Tutustu meihin lisää yrityskohtaisesta työehtosopimuksestamme! Tule rakentamaan omaa urapolkuasi meille! Mikäli tämä tehtävä voisi olla seuraava askel urallasi, haethan tehtävää 7.12.2025 mennessä. Etenemme rekrytointiprosessissa heti sopivan kandidaatin löydyttyä. Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa Jan-Christian Sjelvgren, numerosta 0505508652. Finanssialan asiakkaiden kanssa työskennellessä luottamus ja vastuullisuus ovat toimintamme edellytys, minkä vuoksi tehtävään valittavalle henkilölle tullaan tekemään perusmuotoinen turvallisuusselvitys sekä luottotietojen tarkastus. Tutustu meihin lisää: CGI Ura Facebook , Instagram , LinkedIn , X , YouTube #LI-MP5 Skills: Customer Interface Management Delivery Management English Finnish Scrum Master What you can expect from us: Together, as owners, let's turn meaningful insights into action. Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you'll reach your full potential because... You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That's why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company's strategy and direction. Your work creates value. You'll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise. You'll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You'll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons. Come join our team-one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

954c39034983400d.title: Enterprise Architect, Marine and Navy
954c39034983400d.description: Wärtsilä is an innovative technology company known for being a forerunner in the Marine and Energy markets. Every day, we - Wärtsilians - put our hearts and minds into turning Wärtsilä's purpose of enabling sustainable societies through innovation in technology and services into reality. Our ultimate aim is to provide increased value to both our customers and society. New, game-changing ideas and continuous improvement have been part of our DNA since 1834. Together, we can create new business opportunities and more sustainable future that we can all be proud of. We want to transition the world towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. By pushing the boundaries of engineering and technology, we can make it work. We are always on the lookout for future-oriented talent - want to join the ride? This recruitment is handled by Nawia. All the applications are accepted only via Nawia https://recruitcrm.io/apply/17645961336080105163LEv . Please note that applications via Wärtsilä Careers portal will not be taken into account. We are always on the lookout for a talent with a growth mindset - are you the one? We are looking for a Enterprise Architect, Marine and Navy to join our Enterprise Architecture team working for a better future. The preferred location for this position is Vaasa or Helsinki, Finland . We offer the possibility of hybrid work. Your role and responsibilities As a Enterprise Architect, Marine and Navy your work will focus to developing the Enterprise Architecture of Wärtsilä and for Wärtsilä Marine, but more specifically Navy. On a typical day, you might be starting with interesting discussions about upcoming strategic projects and end the day with advising business on the next possible steps to secure compliance to different customer requirements. You will not be working on this alone, even though the work requires a high level of independency, as you will have the support of our business, cyber and IT organisation. Your work will focus on these responsibilities: Co-creation of strategic Information Technology related roadmaps for Marine Businesses especially in Navy context. Describing the needed development actions from business, information, application, and technical aspects to reach desired business outcomes. Based on the co-created roadmap, further planning of signature-ready development initiatives together with IT organization and business stakeholders. Guiding and supporting of key development initiatives/projects. Working as trusted advisor towards Marine Businesses and participating in development ideation. To be able to succeed in the position, we expect you to have: 10+ years of experience in Business and/or IT in global environment M.Sc. University degree Knowledge on how to create roadmaps, design fit-for-purpose cyber secure solutions and have skills to model and visualize needed change to achieve target position of business Fluency in ensuring how compliance requirements are fulfilled with IT solutions Understanding of complex international business environments and experience working with different stakeholders, from business Vice President to a technical specialist The ability to think strategically and capability to work as trusted advisor towards business Prior experience of Navy as operating environment is considered as an asset, as well as understanding of regulatory standards and frameworks such as NIST, NIS2, 05-138, ANSSI, ABDO, CMMC or DISP Why you and us? We at Wärtsilä believe in empowerment, ownership and taking responsibility of our work. We support each other's growth, and co-creation is the true basis of our innovation. We have courage to see opportunities and take initiative. We are authentic and honest, and we strongly believe in that by being your own true self you can accomplish so much more. We don't always get it right the first time, and if mistakes are made, we make sure to learn and grow from them. We want everyone to voice their opinions freely. That is why we have built an environment that empowers you and everyone around you, and where you can feel safe and cared for. Are you eager to be part of this ambition? We have an amazing team, and we are excited about our work and the impact it has on building sustainable societies. We are looking to find a colleague with this shared passion for smart technologies and a sustainable future. Contact & next steps We hope to hear from you soon by submitting your application through our careers portal. We aim to keep you updated on the process throughout.
