1478025.title: Senior Software Engineer (m/w/d)
1478025.description:
Job description:
It's more than a job
In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel's global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.
We're looking for an experienced Senior Developer to join our team, someone who will take ownership of designing, maintaining, and continuously improving a critical screening service. This service validates parties, individuals, and their addresses against multiple sanctions lists. The primary objective is to ensure full compliance with regulatory requirements and sanctioned regimes, which is crucial for keeping our trade control and compliance processes running smoothly.
In this role, you will be responsible for improving the services accuracy, scalability, and efficiency through development practices, automation, and performance optimization. You will work closely with compliance teams to deliver dependable solutions that reduce risk and strengthen our compliance framework. Your efforts will play a key role in ensuring the company remains protected against sanctions-related challenges.
How you create impact
Design, implement, and maintain secure, scalable, and maintainable software.
Ensure quality through automated testing (unit, integration, UI, performance) and targeted manual tests.
Design and optimize database models, queries, and performance.
Follow clean code practices, contributing to code reviews and development standards.
Proactively improve the codebase: refactor for simplicity, performance, and maintainability on a continuous basis.
Participate in planning discussions and technical evaluation of features and changes.
Collaborate closely with developers, Product Owners, analysts, and other stakeholders.
What we would like you to bring
5+ years of hands-on software development experience in enterprise and cloud environments, with strong expertise in Java, Spring Boot, and relational databases (Postgres, MySQL).
Experienced with frontend frameworks (Angular, ReactJS) and RESTful API design, with a deep understanding of efficient messaging systems such as Kafka and RMQ.
Hands-on experience working with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI).
Proven experience designing and implementing systems optimized for high availability, scalability, and performance, capable of handling large data volumes and high request rates.
Experience with AWS environment setup, automation, and maintenance is highly desirable.
Proven ability to write clean, maintainable code and a commitment to continuous code improvement.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, combined with strong communication and mentoring skills. Proficient in both written and spoken English.
Strong sense of ownership, initiative, and accountability for product quality and technical direction.
What's in it for you
Join Kuehne+Nagel's IT Hub in Tallinn, where your work will have a meaningful impact on the logistics industry. Here, you'll find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You'll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don't tick every box, we encourage you to apply - your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

d663a5a284635d35.title: Työnjohtaja
d663a5a284635d35.description: JTK Power on erikoistunut vaativien teräsratkaisujen valmistamiseen maailman johtaville yrityksille voimalaitoksiin, rakennusalalle sekä laiva- ja prosessiteollisuuteen yli 60 vuoden kokemuksella. Käytännössä valmistamme äänenvaimentimia, väestönsuojatuotteita sekä tarjoamme mekaanista ja akustista palvelua. Teemme myös vaativia koneistus- ja alihankintatöitä. JTK Power tunnetaan maailmanlaajuisesti alansa parhaasta teknologiaosaamisestaan, toimitusvarmuudesta ja tuotteidensa mittatarkkuudesta. Tuotteitamme löytyy kaikilla mantereilla, jopa 160 maassa. JTK Power muodostuu emoyhtiö JTK Power Oy:stä ja Kiinan tytäryhtiöstä JTK Power Suzhou Co:sta. Työllistämme 140 työntekijää ja liikevaihtomme on 30 M€. Suomessa tehtaamme sijaitsevat Vöyrillä ja Isossakyrössä. Olemme osa ruotsalaista Koncentra -konsernia . Menestyksemme syntyy työntekijöidemme osaamisen kehittämisestä ja arvostamisesta sekä yhteistyöstä asiakkaidemme kanssa. Lue meistä lisää: www.jtk-power-group.com Oletko valmistavan teollisuuden työnjohtamisen ammattilainen? Etsimme sinusta vahvistusta hitsausosastollemme Vöyriin, jossa yhdessä osaavan henkilöstömme kanssa pääset mahdollistamaan vahvan kasvumme. Tule mukaan rakentamaan suomalaisen vientiyrityksen menestystarinaa! Työnjohtaja Tulet työskentelemään yli 40 henkilöä työllistävällä hitsausosastollamme, jossa otat ensivaiheessa vastuun noin 10 henkilön työnjohdosta. Kasvuumme liittyen tiimisi henkilöstömäärä tulee kuitenkin kasvamaan lähiaikoina noin 20 työntekijään. Työtä tehdään päivävuorossa arkipäivisin. Työn suunnittelua teemme uudella toiminnanohjausjärjestelmällämme Monitorilla ja työnkuormitusta vielä toistaiseksi Excel-pohjaisesti. Raportoit vastuualueestasi tuotantopäälliköllemme Jussille. Arjen työtehtäviäsi ovat: Päivittäisen työn organisointi ja ohjaus vastuualueellasi Riittävistä resursseista huolehtiminen ja resurssien tehokas kohdentaminen Tuotannon sujuvuuden, tehokkuuden ja turvallisuuden varmistaminen Tuotantotavoitteiden ja aikataulujen seuraaminen ja niissä pysyminen Työn laadun ja tuotantoprosessien jatkuva kehittäminen Henkilöstön perehdytys, motivointi ja osaamisen kehittämisen tukeminen Aktiivinen yhteistyö sidosryhmien kanssa Päivittäinen raportointi ja toiminnanohjausjärjestelmän käyttö Edellytämme sinulta soveltuvaa teknisen alan koulutusta (esim. kone- ja metallitekniikan koulutus) tai työkokemuksen kautta hankittua vastaavaa osaamista.  Sinulla tulee olla aiempaa kokemusta valmistavan teollisuuden esihenkilötehtävistä, mieluiten konepajateollisuudesta. Arvostamme mahdollista osaamistasi hitsaustekniikoista ja -menetelmistä. Sinulla on hyvät dokumentointi- ja viestintätaidot sekä kyky lukea ja tulkita teknisiä piirustuksia ja standardeja. Työskentely monikulttuurisessa työyhteisössämme edellyttää englannin kielen taitoa. Henkilönä olet järjestelmällinen ja ratkaisukeskeinen tiimipeluri, joka kykenee johtamaan tiimiä määrätietoisesti ja kannustavasti. Sinulla on hyvät vuorovaikutustaidot sekä kyky luoda avoin ja luottamukseen perustuva ilmapiiri tiimissäsi. Arvostamme oma-aloitteisuutta, vastuullisuutta ja halua kehittää sekä itseäsi että työympäristöäsi. Johdat työtä esimerkilläsi ja näet laadun, turvallisuuden ja jatkuvan parantamisen olennaisena osana päivittäistä toimintaa. Miksi kannattaa hakea juuri meille? Alan johtavana toimijana tarjoamme sinulle avaimet onnistumiseen. Meillä on monipuolinen tuoteportfolio, joista on mahdollista räätälöidä aina toimiva ratkaisu kuhunkin asiakastarpeeseen. Olemme tunnettuja laadusta ja toimitusvarmuudesta ja meillä on myös erinomaiset referenssit. Meillä on kiva ja osaava työyhteisö, jossa autamme toisiamme onnistumaan. Lue lisää millaista meillä on työskennellä Työsuhde-etujamme: Kilpailukykyinen palkkaus Lounasetu Epassi: liikunta-, kulttuuri- ja hyvinvointi Kattavat työterveyspalvelut Vapaa-ajan tapaturmavakuutus Tartu tähän mahdollisuuteen ja esittele rohkeasti itsesi! Täytämme paikan soveltuvan henkilön löydyttyä, joten lähetäthän hakemuksesi mahdollisimman pian. Tiedustelut ja hakuohjeet: Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa rekrytointikumppanimme Mentekin konsultti Jani Kallio numerossa 050 529 2715 tai jani.kallio@mentek.fi Jätä hakemuksesi Hae-nappia klikkaamalla. Tervetuloa mukaan rekrytointiprosessiin!

fb81de405c1d9749.title: Pääsuunnittelija ajoneuvosuunnitteluun
fb81de405c1d9749.description: Patria on työpaikka, jossa rakennat yhteistä turvallisuutta. Meillä tavalliset ihmiset ratkaisevat epätavallisia haasteita. Kun on kyse kriittisistä operaatioista maalla, merellä, ilmassa ja verkossa, osaamisella on merkitystä. Laatu syntyy ihmisistä – jokaisesta meistä. Patriassa sinä ratkaiset. Patria on kansainvälinen puolustus-, turvallisuus- ja ilmailualan luotettu asiakaskeskeisten elinkaaren tukipalvelujen ja teknologiaratkaisujen tuottaja, jolla on vahva kasvustrategia. Protected Mobility vastaa uusien ajoneuvojen ja ajoneuvojärjestelmien myynnistä sekä niiden tarjonnasta ja toimituksista. Meillä on hyvät valmiudet tarjota ajoneuvokalustoamme eri loppukäyttäjille eurooppalaisten ohjelmien, kuten johtamamme Common Armored Vehicle System (CAVS) -ohjelman kautta. Haemme nyt joukkoomme Pääsuunnittelijaa ajoneuvosuunnitteluun. Tehtävässä tuotat ajoneuvoversion rakenteen sarjavalmistusta varten asiakkaan tarpeiden ja ajoneuvon käyttötarkoituksen mukaan. Vastaat versiovarustelun suunnittelusta kokonaisuutena ja huolehdit myös siitä, että muiden toimittajien järjestelmät integroidaan ajoneuvoon oikealla tavalla. Pääsuunnittelijana ohjaat osaltasi muiden suunnittelijoiden työtä, myös alihankintasuunnittelua, ja toimit tiiviissä yhteistyössä Systems Engineerin Managerien ja projektipäällikköjen kanssa. Työtehtävät ovat vaihtelevia, suunnittelutyön lisäksi huolehdit toimitusprojektien onnistumisesta niin aikataulun, tavoitteiden kuin asiakasvaatimusten osalta. Tehtävässä keskitytään erityisesti pyöräajoneuvojen toimitusprojekteihin, mutta projektien salliessa voit osallistua myös tuotekehitykseen. Millaista osaajaa etsimme? Työtehtävässä menestyminen edellyttää useamman vuoden kokemusta ajoneuvotuotteiden suunnittelusta, sekä ymmärrystä laajoista mekaanisista ja sähköteknisistä kokonaisuuksista. Projektilähtöinen työskentelytapa ja kokemus projektihallinnasta ovat selvä etu, kuten myös kyky luoda yhteisiä ratkaisuja mekaniikka- ja sähkösuunnittelun sidosryhmien kanssa. Aiempi kokemus yhteistyöstä toimittajien ja asiakkaiden kanssa on suuri etu. Hakijalta edellytetään sujuvaa suomen ja englannin kielen taitoa sekä lisäksi satunnaista matkustusvalmiutta projektien tarpeiden mukaisesti. Hakijalta toivomme osaamista seuraavilla osa-alueille: Mekaniikkakokoonpanot NX/Teamcenter työkaluilla Rakenteenhallinta Ajoneuvon rakenteiden massan hallinta Eduksi katsotaan: Kokemus tuotevaatimusten käsittelystä. Kokemus ajoneuvojen testauksesta, verifioinnista ja tuotannollistamisesta Mitä tarjoamme: Meillä Patriassa pääset tekemään sellaista, mitä muualla et pääse edes näkemään. Sinulla on mahdollisuus pitkään ja monipuoliseen työuraan Patrian ainutlaatuisten tuotteiden ja toimintojen parissa. Tarjoamme sinulle henkilöstöetuna mm. vuosittaisen tulospalkkiomallin sekä lounas- ja virike-edun. Meillä on kattavat työterveyspalvelut, joihin sisältyy esim. erikoislääkäripalvelut. Tarjoamme myös vapaa-ajan tapaturmavakuutuksen työntekijöillemme. Arvostamme myös vapaa-aikaasi, joten meillä pystyt tasapainottamaan työn ja vapaa-ajan joustavasti esimerkiksi hyödyntämällä liukuvaa työaikaa. Tehtävässä on 50/50 etätyömahdollisuus. Pääset tutustumaan tarkemmin patrialaisiin ja meillä työskentelyyn täältä . Haluaisitko olla osa tarinaamme? Voit jättää hakemuksesi rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta. Haethan tehtävää 14.12.2025 mennessä. Käsittelemme hakemuksia jo hakuajan puitteissa ja valinnat tehdään heti soveltuvien henkilöiden löydyttyä. Huomiothan, että emme käsittele sähköpostitse lähetettyjä hakemuksia. Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa Juha Pääskyvuori 📞 +358 40 869 6763 ✉️ juha.paaskyvuori@patriagroup.com Käsittelemme tietojasi luottamuksellisesti. Paikkaan valitulle henkilölle tehdään turvallisuusselvitys ja huumausainetesti. Miksi Patria? 1. Turvaa yhteiskunnalle: edistämme ylpeydellä kansallista ja kansainvälistä turvallisuutta. Siihen tarvitaan vastuullista asennetta ja huippuosaamista, joka takaa toimintavarmuuden kaikissa olosuhteissa. 2. Sinä vaikutat: Patriassa sinä vaikutat työsi sisältöön, urasi kehittymiseen, asiakkaidesi ja koko yrityksen menestykseen. Meillä voit olla juuri niin hyvä kuin ikinä voit olla. 3. Keskity tärkeimpään: tee sitä, mitä rakastat ja näe kättesi jäljet. Olet meille ratkaisevan tärkeä. Haluamme että voit hyvin ja elät töiden ohella täyttä elämää. 4. Mahtava porukka: meillä teet työtä uudistuvassa ja energisessä työyhteisössä, jossa on hymy herkässä. Uskomme, että parhaat tulokset syntyvät hyvässä ilmapiirissä

ffcc6ee6d2b1f90f.title: Full Stack Tech Lead
ffcc6ee6d2b1f90f.description: Kyllästyttääkö hidas kehittäminen ja projektista toiseen pomppiminen? Haluaisitko mieluummin tehdä työtä, jossa pääset vaikuttamaan media-alan digitransformaatioon aitiopaikalla? Haemme nyt Digitaalisten palvelut, Data ja AI -tiimiimme Full Stack Tech Leadia Tehtävässä vastuullasi ovat Viestimedian digitaaliset palvelut, jotka vaikuttavat viikoittain yli puolen miljoonan suomalaisen elämään. Pääset kehittämään moderneja verkkosovelluksiamme pitkäjänteisesti aina suunnittelusta toteutukseen sekä ylläpitoon yhdessä pienen ja ketterän tiimimme kanssa. Pääset myös kehittämään tekoälyratkaisuja sekä Viestimedian henkilökunnan että asiakkaidemme hyödyksi. Olet tehtävään oikea henkilö, jos sinulta löytyy näkemyksellisyyttä, itsenäistä ongelmanratkaisukykyä sekä aloitteellisuutta. Pystyt ottamaan vastuuta, mutta olet ennen kaikkea tiimipelaaja ja jaat mielelläsi oppeja myös koko tiimille. Työskentelet tiiviissä yhteistyössä niin sisäisten kuin ulkoistenkin kumppaneiden kanssa. Menestyäksesi sinulla tulisi olla kokemusta seuraavista asioista: Node.js, React, TypeScript AWS (Lambda, S3, ECS, API Gateway, ECR, CloudWatch) AWS CDK Docker GitHub Actions CI/CD PostgreSQL Git workflow management Nice to have: OpenSearch/Elasticsearch Azure AI/ML-kehitys Bash scripting Python Next.js, Remix/react-router Figma Semanttinen HTML + CSS Saavutettavuusosaaminen Plussaa on myös kokemus headless CMS:stä, (S)CSS:stä, microservice-arkkitehtuurista sekä integraatioista. Tekoälyosaaminen ja ymmärrys palveluiden jatkokehittämisestä, ylläpidosta ja moderneista työkaluista sekä ketteristä menetelmistä nostavat sinut seuraavalle tasolle. Tarjoamme sinulle mahdollisuuden rakentaa tulevaisuuden mediapalveluita yhdessä osaavien ja mukavien työkavereiden kanssa. Merkitykselliseen ja monipuoliseen työhön sisältyy kilpailukykyisen palkan lisäksi hyvät ja kattavat henkilöstöedut. Juuri uudistettu ja erittäin viihtyisä toimistomme sijaitsee aivan Helsingin ydinkeskustassa, mutta työskentelemme hyvinkin joustavalla hybridimallilla. Epäröitkö vielä? Jos yllä kuvatun lisäksi arvomme (juureva, yhdessä uudistuva ja rehdisti inhimillinen) puhuttelevat sinua, niin hae 7.12. mennessä täyttämällä hakemus ansioluetteloineen. Lisätietoja antaa: Kehityksen päällikkö Taru Salo, puh. 044 057 0777 maanantaina 24.11. klo 12-13 sekä perjantaina 28.11. klo 10-11. Viestimedia Oy on Suomen johtava maaseutuun, metsään ja kotiin liittyvien mediasisältöjen tuottaja. Monikanavaiset mediamme ovat tunnettuja ja luotettuja. Päätuotteitamme ovat uutismedia Maaseudun Tulevaisuus sekä aikakausmediat Koneviesti ja Metsänomistajan Aarre. Olemme panostaneet voimakkaasti digitaalisiin palveluihin ja tuotamme palkittuja sisältöjä sekä tunnustettuja teknisiä ratkaisuja. Yrityksemme työllistää noin 100 media-alan ammattilaista. Ylpeästi juureva. Yhdessä uudistuva. Rehdisti inhimillinen. www.viestimedia.fi. Rekrytoinnin tietosuojaselosteemme löydät täältä .

ac48c3d453f839d0.title: Lead Service Designer, Digital Consumer Offering
ac48c3d453f839d0.description: Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2.4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve customers in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain. About the role Are you passionate about designing seamless, human-centered services that deliver measurable impact? We are looking for an experienced and strategic Lead Service Designer to join our team in DCO. In this role, you will own and drive service design initiatives end-to-end, ensuring our digital services are intuitive, valuable, and aligned with real customer needs. You will collaborate with product teams, business stakeholders, and technology experts to shape service products and experiences that differentiate Fortum in the marketplace. You will also play a key role in strengthening our Design Community of Practice, mentoring peers, and embedding service design principles across the organization. This role is located in Espoo. Key responsibilities: Lead end-to-end service design processes: From discovery to delivery, applying service design methodologies to uncover customer needs and design impactful solutions. Own and refine user testing approaches: Develop and manage our Nordic user panel strategy, ensuring robust testing and continuous improvement. Service improvement: Identify pain points and opportunities in existing services; propose and validate enhancements that improve customer experience and business value. Cross-functional collaboration: Work closely with product managers, UX designers, developers, and business stakeholders to deliver key design artifacts such as journey maps, service blueprints, and prototypes using innovative tools such as TheyDo. Customer-centric development: Use qualitative and quantitative research to inform strategy and design decisions, validating hypotheses with real customer insights. Prototyping and testing: Design and test service prototypes to gather feedback and iterate quickly for both B2C and B2B offerings. Strategic alignment: Translate business objectives into actionable service design initiatives with measurable outcomes. Facilitation and communication: Lead workshops, discovery sessions, and stakeholder alignment activities; communicate design concepts through compelling storytelling and visual artifacts. Community leadership: Mentor and support colleagues to promote best practices and foster a culture of experimentation and continuous learning. About you To succeed in this role, you bring: 8+ years of experience in service design, UX design, or business design, supported by a relevant educational background (e.g., B.Sc . or MBA in Service Design or similar). Proven track record in service design for digital consumer products, ideally in complex, multi-market environments. Strong expertise in user research, design leadership, business design, service design methodologies, and facilitation techniques. Ability to balance strategic thinking with hands-on execution, driving both vision and delivery. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence and align diverse business units. A collaborative, empathetic mindset and passion for creating customer-centric service experiences. Fluent skills in English. Fluency in Finnish will be considered a plus. We offer you At Fortum, you’ll have the opportunity to shape digital services that impact millions of customers while working in a dynamic, forward-thinking environment. You’ll collaborate with talented professionals, contribute to sustainability goals, and help embed service design as a strategic capability across the organization. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally. More information about our culture and benefits can be found here . Interested? Submit your CV at latest on 12th of December . Please include a link to your portfolio showcasing your best service design work or add it as an attachment in the cover letter field in the job application form. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Yonatan Kelib via email yonatan.kelib@fortum.com . To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing. We are Fortum Fortum is a Nordic energy company. We generate and deliver reliable energy to our customers and the Nordic energy system while at the same time helping industries decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations comprise efficient and best-in-class low-carbon power generation, customer services, and heating and cooling. Fortum’s power generation is already 99% from renewable or nuclear sources with one of the lowest specific CO2-emissions in Europe. We are guided by our ambitious SBTi-validated emission reduction targets on our way towards net-zero by 2040. For our ~4,500 employees, we commit to be a safe and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

7cb94a8e96f4616c.title: Solution Architect - Agile Data Engine
7cb94a8e96f4616c.description: We're on a mission to make data work easier, faster, and a lot more fun - with one clear goal: creating measurable business impact. Agile Data Engine (ADE) helps organizations automate the heavy lifting of building and maintaining modern cloud-based data platforms. Our team bridges product development and hands-on customer work - and that's where you come in. We're looking for a Solution Architect who loves designing elegant, scalable solutions and guiding customers on how to get the most out of their data. You'll be the key link between our customers, product team, and the ADE community - helping shape architectures, onboard new users, and ensure projects turn into long-term success stories. What you'll do Design and guide customer architectures that are scalable, secure, and future-proof Lead technical onboarding and ensure smooth project kick-offs Act as a trusted advisor - turning complex business needs into smart, data-driven solutions Be part of leading the change toward AI-driven data work - helping customers understand and harness the power of AI and automation in their data platforms Be hands-on with modern cloud technologies such as Snowflake, Databricks,Google Cloud, Microsoft Fabric and Agile Data Engine (ADE) Build and share reusable assets like documentation, GitHub examples, and training materials Collaborate closely with ADE's product and engineering teams to influence the roadmap with real-world insights Solve challenging customer cases (3rd-level support) when things get tricky Share your knowledge through community talks, articles, or events What makes you a great fit Good understanding of Agile Data Engine (ADE) or motivation to deepen your expertise with it while working alongside our product and customer teams 3+ years of experience in solution architecture, data architecture, or system design , ideally in SaaS or B2B environments Strong understanding of cloud platforms, data modeling, and integration patterns Proven ability to translate business goals into scalable, maintainable technical designs Curiosity for AI, automation, and emerging data technologies Bachelor's degree in Computer Science , Engineering, or a relevant field is preferred A proactive, collaborative mindset - you make things happen and help others succeed But instead of just individual technology skills, we're looking for a new colleague with a caring and easy-going mindset, enthusiasm, and eagerness to help and learn new things . What we offer Modern working culture that supports your personal goals and growth A chance to have a real impact on how data platforms are built and scaled Work with leading companies across the EMEA region Hybrid or remote setup - we work fluently in both environments Opportunities to expand your know-how across data engineering, cloud, and AI Competitive salary and a wide range of perks and benefits A genuinely supportive, low-hierarchy team that values collaboration and curiosity What to expect We aim to make the hiring process as smooth as our product. We believe we ensure the best fit for you and ADE with a prescreening call, two rounds of interviews, and reference checks before the decision. Ready to make data architecture smarter? If this sounds like your next challenge, we'd love to hear from you. Apply below by 30 November - and let's talk! Team Services Locations Helsinki, Lahti, Oulu, Tampere Remote status Hybrid

76471fad25a9f854.title: Product Owner, Maventa
76471fad25a9f854.description: We are looking for an enthusiastic Product Owner for Maventa to continue our international growth story! Maventa is a state of the art API-first SaaS electronic invoice and document exchange hub, operating in Europe, and serving close to 300 000 companies. Our platform serves tens of millions of transactions each month with superior scalability. What to expect when you join us? E-invoicing is an essential component of Europe's economic framework, and Maventa is at the forefront as the leading e-invoicing operator in the Nordics. We aim to extend our reach to become the leading provider for SMB companies across Europe. This is the perfect opportunity to join a fast-paced company with a committed multinational team working mostly remote. Our SaaS product has a huge impact in automating economies and needless to say we got some really interesting customer pains to solve. Good to understand from our product is that the UI really is playing a side role in it. The focus is on the API. As one of our Product Owners, you will be responsible for invoice receiving. Your key responsibilities are: Guiding the team in making the Product Manager's vision come true, transforming the vision into smaller and concrete deliverables Managing the team's backlog, creating, detailing and prioritising user stories based on customer feedback and company objectives Interacting with our customers and other relevant stakeholders, gathering understanding of their needs Give input to product roadmap planning and execution Utilising data in customer value creation, verifying created value through objective measurements and communication the results to key stakeholders Communicate across the company with Product Manager, Commercial, Marketing, Sales and Support teams when required. Keep track of evolving regulations, what's happening in the industry and in the market, and apply your knowledge to creating the best product. Act as a domain expert within the company, in relevant industry forums and in helping our Marketing succeed. We know that our domain needs some learning so the last bullet points may be something we'll help you grow into! You succeed by having the following: 2+ years previous experience in working as a Product Owner, preferably in SaaS, or as a Business Analyst Relevant education from business or tech. Understanding on how to utilise AI in your daily work Experience with agile methods in software development Ability to keep things simple and easily understandable Willingness to learn new things and having a growth mindset Excellent communication skills and ability to inspire development team and stakeholders A strong understanding of technical concepts to effectively engage in discussions with engineers and stakeholders Knowledge of API-related aspects, including integration and development Fluent English skills. Finnish language skills are not a must, but a plus! Plus for: prior knowledge about the E-invoicing domain or an adjacent domain such payments, AR/AP or ERP business What do we offer? To put it simply, work that matters! E-invoicing has a tremendous impact on societies through automation of B2B/B2G transactions and VAT reporting. Our culture is defined by freedom and responsibility. We take responsibility for our customers, set challenging goals, and give a lot of responsibility for achieving results. We are committed, curious, active, and solution-oriented team players. We also invest in skill development, and we want to help you shine! We naturally have a comprehensive list of benefits, including sports & culture, lunch, extended healthcare, dental and learning resources. You will also have the power of the Visma group and the ambitious, collaborative and fun Maventa team consisting of 50 colleagues backing you up. The salary range in this position is estimated to be 4000-5000 € per month , depending on your experience and background. Please let us know about your salary and general expectations in your application or cover letter. The position is for permanent employment. The recruitment process includes two interviews and a work ability test, with a third interview possible in case we have very equal candidates. We work in a hybrid setting and have an office in Helsinki (Tripla). Working from other remote locations in Finland, such as Tampere or Lappeenranta, is negotiable. Currently we are unable to offer relocation support. We are looking forward to hearing from you Please apply to the position by 21.12.2025 . We want to hear about your experience, skills and salary request in your cover letter and/or CV or LinkedIn profile. We process applications already during the application period, so we hope to hear from you soon! Any questions? Please don't hesitate to contact Rami Sirenius, Team Leader, rami.sirenius@visma.com Maventa is an API-first SaaS product, an e-invoicing platform. We are responsible for a state of the art electronic invoice and document exchange hub, operating in several countries, and serving close to 300 000 companies. Our platform serves tens of millions of transactions each month. Maventa is part of the Visma Group, which is Europe's largest SaaS company. Department Software Development Role Product Owner Locations Helsinki Remote status Hybrid Company Maventa Oy Application deadline 21 December, 2025

1479989.title: Senior Frontend Platform Engineer
1479989.description:
About the Role:
The Senior Frontend Platform Engineer role focus on building the systems, tools, and pipelines that enable engineers to deliver high-quality software more efficiently and reliably. This is not a product feature development role. Instead, Frontend Platform Engineer will work at the intersection of tooling, infrastructure, and developer experience to improve the effectiveness and velocity of engineering teams working in a large-scale monorepo environment. Creating cleaner, faster, and more resilient workflows, robust automation and reliable pipelines are essential to productive software development.

What You'll Do::
Developer Experience & Tooling
Identify friction points in frontend workflows and design automation solutions to remove them.
Own and evolve tooling across our client monorepo using technologies like Vite and Nx.
Provide technical support and guidance to engineers to help them use internal tools effectively.
CI/CD Pipeline Optimization
Design and optimize frontend-specific CI/CD workflows for speed, reliability, and scalability.
Extend CI/CD pipelines with capabilities such as preview app deployments, Lighthouse CI, Storybook and static asset analysis.
Collaborate with platform teams to build standardized, scalable pipeline templates and integrations.
Cross-functional Enablement
Partner with product engineering teams to identify friction points in build, test, and deployment processes.
Promote adoption of best practices through internal education, technical guidance, and documentation.
Act as an advocate for continuous improvement and operational excellence in frontend development.

What You'll Bring::
Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript, with hands-on experience in modern frontend frameworks (e.g., React, Vue, Angular).
Deep understanding of frontend build systems and tools (e.g., Vite, Webpack, Rollup, Nx).
Practical knowledge of CI/CD systems (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins), with a track record of building or maintaining pipelines.
Background as a frontend engineer with a focus on developer productivity, tooling, or infrastructure.
Excellent debugging and communication skills, with a collaborative approach to problem-solving.
Experience working in and maintaining large-scale frontend monorepos, preferred.
Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP), preferred.
Familiarity with developer experience metrics and a methodical approach to continuous improvement, preferred.
Experience building and maintaining internal developer tools used at scale, preferred.

What Makes Us Great::
Comprehensive compensation
Work-life balance initiatives
Autonomy we embrace personal freedom and responsibility
Creativity we are open to new ideas of how we can be better
Growth we want you to develop personally as well as professionally
Top-notch professionals who are passionate about what they do
People-oriented environment and supportive atmosphere
As a rapidly growing company in an emerging industry, youll have a huge impact on our product and our company. We like proactive team members and strive to have a company of self-disciplined professionals who enjoy collaboration, having fun, and of course, achieving together what others believe to be improbable. We are dedicated to treating everyone with respect and to support your professional and personal growth.
Rush Street Interactive is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, sexual identity and expression, marital status, family status, lifestyle, age, culture, religion, military and veteran status, citizenship, or disability.
Be at the forefront of this ground-breaking industry! Apply now!

1480238.title: Software Engineer (Credit Path)

Analyze, discuss, and implement business requirements while maintaining good documentation of the systems and components you create.
Implement and advocate for industry standards and best practices to continually improve our codebase and architecture.
Make a positive impact on our engineering culture by adopting, implementing, and providing feedback on both organizational and industry standards and practices.

What do we offer::
Inclusive and valuing culture
At Riverty, you can be who you are. We strive to create an inclusive environment and an appreciative culture, enhanced by our employee networks.

1478451.title: Multilingual Global Client Associate
1478451.description:
Responsibilities:
Resolve routine and complex client service issues thoroughly and expeditiously via phone, email, and chat, utilizing sound judgment and emphasizing courtesy. Client inquiries typically encompass a wide array of themes, including the operability of IBKR Trader Workstation, Web Trader and Mobile Trader execution platforms, trading modules and analytical tools.
Cash deposit and withdrawal activity, position transfers, and account administrative functions
Product availability and attributes
Exchange, clearing and depository functions; Order types and routing logic; Order status, trade and delivery settlement, exercise & assignment, expiration processing, and corporate actions
Margin calculations, commission structure, interest and fees
Coordinate activities with other local and international Client Service divisions and interact with external departments such as Programming, Clearing, Cashiering and Compliance on common issues. Contribute to the development of client service systems, policies and procedures.

Qualifications, Skills & Attributes:
Bachelors or advanced degree in finance, economics or a related field
2-3 years of experience in client services or related field.
Strong verbal and written communication skills to accommodate client inquiries directed via telephone, email and online chat
General understanding of the following financial instruments: stocks, securities options, futures, options on futures, foreign exchange and fixed-income
Languages:
Fluent in English + Italian/French/Spanish/Russian
Ability to work in a dynamic, medium-size office environment
Candidates must have an EU passport or a qualifying work permit/residency to work in Estonia.

Company Benefits & Perks :
Discretionary, performance based bonus
Private health insurance, sport activity compensation
Stock incentive plan

Hybrid way of working (2 days home office/week)
Great atmosphere with friendly and exceptional colleagues and frequent company outings.

: https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/ibkr/jobs/7700175002

1479934.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
1479934.description:
Requirements for candidates:
Your Skills and Experiences
Degree in computer science or a related field.
Proficiency in development tools like Eclipse/IntelliJ, Maven, Git, and Jenkins.
Strong expertise in Java and JUnit, with additional knowledge in Spring, JPA/Hibernate, and SQL being a plus.
Experience in frontend development, with Angular as a must-have skill.
Ability to find pragmatic and innovative solutions that maximize business value.
Strong problem-solving skills with a creative and innovative approach.
Highly self-motivated, detail-oriented, and result-driven, with excellent teamwork and collaboration abilities.
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.

Job description:
Your Responsibilities
Focus on developing the new Air Logistics System by implementing functional and technical components in a modern continuous delivery environment.
Ensure quality and long-term maintainability of the software.
Contribute to migrating from a Java Swing application to a new Angular app while troubleshooting and optimizing existing code.
Conduct development tests, code reviews, and create unit tests to maintain high code quality.
Participate in the entire development lifecycle, from requirements gathering to product delivery.
Collaborate regularly with the Air Logistics Team to find the best technical and functional solutions for new features and improvements.
Gain expertise in the air logistics business domain and work with continuously online production systems.
Support system maintenance, application rollouts, and operations as part of the development support team.

What we offer:
Good Reasons to Join
Join Kuehne+Nagels IT Hub in Tallinn, where your work will have a meaningful impact on the logistics industry. Here, youll find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. Youll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you dont tick every box, we encourage you to apply your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

Your Role
As a Software Engineer, you will be part of a cross-functional product team working on our mission-critical AirLOG application, which supports our Air Forwarding operations around the world. As part of a global team of engineers and analysts, you will build products to deliver innovative solutions that delight our Air Logistics stakeholders. Following the principles of agile software development, you will be involved throughout the entire development lifecycle. You'll work closely with diverse teams, brainstorming, designing, coding and refining to develop reliable and customer-focused solutions to support and enhance our Air Logistics services.

1480454.title: Senior Software Engineer .NET (AaaS)
1480454.description:
What you bring:
6+ years hands-on in C#/.NET, including direct contribution to architectural decisions - not just code writing, but supporting redesign and migration.
Strategic, outcome-driven experience in cloud platforms - Azure preferred, but open to reasoned argument for alternatives; know where the hype stops and real business value begins.
Proficiency designing RESTful APIs people actually want to use.
Experience in microservices, distributed architectures, and event-driven integration (bonus for actual deployment at scale).
Practical exposure to messaging, e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka - in production, not just academic.
Basic experience in frontend JS frameworks - enough to communicate with frontend teams or prototype, not necessarily to ship production UIs.
The ability and willingness to challenge company and engineering assumptions, prioritize ruthlessly, and defend your technical choices.
Strong written and spoken English - clarity beats verbosity.
FinTech/banking experience is a plus, but ability to learn fast and question existing norms is essential.

Your key responsibilities:
You will join one of our product teams and on a daily basis:
Assist in tackling architectural and coding challenges within your product team. Your remit: support migration, refactoring, and modernization of our Azure cloud environments. Transformation - NOT superficial patching.
Design, build, test, and deploy robust, maintainable, readable code and APIs, maximizing automation and reliability.
Analyse requirements sceptically, challenge weak assumptions, and assist in architecting systems aligned with future business needs. Document clearly - leave no process ambiguous.
Assist in driving best practices and standards - if something’s broken, outdated, or inefficient, call it out and help fix it.
Actively shape our engineering culture: give direct feedback, adopt new ideas quickly, and question the status quo.
Participate fully in agile processes, but bring tough-minded scrutiny to deadlines, priorities, and work scope.
Mentor team members and assist in setting a visible standard for quality and architectural thinking.

What do we offer::
Inclusive and valuing culture
At Riverty, you can be who you are. We strive to create an inclusive environment and an appreciative culture, enhanced by our employee networks.
Health & Wellbeing
Your physical and mental health is important to us. Take advantage of our various preventive care and support services.
Professional and Personal Development

Monetary Benefits & Discounts

Flexibility
Our diverse working models empower you to customize your work to perfectly align with your preferences. Benefit from mobile office, flexible working hours and part-time models.

1480504.title: DevOps Engineer
1480504.description:

Requirements:
Strong Linux and infrastructure experience with solid security awareness.
Hands-on Kubernetes administration and application deployment.
Experience with automation (Ansible, Salt, Jenkins), virtualization, and CI/CD pipelines.
Knowledge of Nginx/HAProxy, cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure), and PostgreSQL HA concepts.
Strong networking fundamentals; Cloudflare is a plus.
Experience with monitoring, logging, and backup systems.
Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, including work with open-source tools.
Effective communicator and collaborator; willing to join a 2nd-level on-call rotation.
Fluent in English.

Tööülesannete kirjeldus:
Key responsibilities:
Automating infrastructure
of a state-of-the-art critical real-time transit ticketing and payment systems used by thousands of vehicles and millions of people across the globe.
Constantly improve the level of automation
in all areas.
Server setup and configuration:
Set up and configure virtual and on-premise servers for deploying and operating the company's software.
Supporting services configuration:
Develop and manage supporting services for servers, including monitoring, backups, and other necessary services.
Operational troubleshooting:
Troubleshoot operational issues on the infrastructure level with the company's services.
Database setup and maintenance:
Set up and maintain databases, with a focus on PostgreSQL, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
Kubernetes cluster management:
Set up and maintain Kubernetes clusters on various platforms, including cloud and on-premises environments. Migrate services and applications there from traditional setups.
Collaboration and assistance:
Assist, advise, and cooperate with colleagues, primarily software developers, to collaboratively implement new solutions and solve issues.
On-call support:
Participate in an on-call schedule for 2nd level operational support.

Omalt poolt pakume:
We offer:
An opportunity to participate in high-impact system development with a combination of hardware and software that influences billions of people around the globe.
Dynamic and challenging work in a growing international technology company.
Passionate and experienced leaders. A company culture that empowers people and where each employee’s contribution counts and is valued.
Opportunity to grow together with an ambitious and expanding company filled with supportive and positive people.
Competitive compensation package.
Passion, fun, and power to make public transportation seamless to use.

1479009.title: Application Support Analyst - Tallinn or Viljandi
1479009.description:
What we Offer:
Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with Sysynkt - a dynamic cloud software scale-up! Our rapid growth and ambitious expansion plans present a
unique opportunity
for
driven professionals and those starting out after graduating
. We are currently seeking an Application Support Analyst.
We're in search of a
resourceful and motivated
Application Support Analyst to join our Customer Success team. Based at either our
state-of-the-art Viljandi office
alongside our engineering team
or in our new Tallinn office
, you'll play a
crucial role in assisting our corporate customers
and users of our cloud business management software. This position is an
ideal starting point
for
recent graduates
or for those aspiring to
kickstart a rewarding career in cloud business software
. At Sysynkt we're dedicated to ensuring that our customers and partners are genuinely delighted with their experience of our products, and this is your chance to play a key part in achieving this goal.
As a
young scale-up
, we all chip in from time-to-time with whatever is needed to make Sysynkt a success so flexibility and adaptability are key requirements, along with a strong desire to work as part of a team but still be motivated and driven when working by yourself. In return you will receive
full training
in our product suite plus an
exciting and dynamic working environment
with highly talented co-workers who care passionately about their roles and the company.
The role is
37.5 hours a week full-time
and is based in our office in Viljandi or Tallinn. You
may be required to work outside the regular 9-5
to cover support for our customers in SE Asia and Australasia.
Whilst we're happy for our team to sometimes work from home the role is office-based as we find it the best way to continually learn from each other in this fast-paced software development. Occasional travel may be also required as we are an international company. A
competitive salary
is offered, dependent upon your experience, plus
28 days paid holiday
and
Stebby benefits
.
**This role does NOT provide sponsorship to obtain an Estonian working visa. Please do not apply for this role if you do not already possess the right to work in Estonia as you will not be considered**

The Role:
As a valued member of the Sysynkt team, your role will encompass these tasks:
Proactively monitor and promptly respond to new customer tickets.
Methodically review, progress, and update existing tickets.
Ensure all tickets are attended to promptly or escalated when necessary.
Conduct remote troubleshooting and guide customers through effective solutions.
Execute comprehensive issue and patch testing.
Master the Sysynkt product suite, and contribute by creating Solution articles, helpful videos and other articles to share knowledge and solutions.
Deepen your understanding of the application and its ecosystem, as well as the business processes of our customers, to provide invaluable insights.
Identify and propose process improvements.
Assist with release testing & communications.

The Ideal Candidate:
If you already enjoy making customers happy, love solving problems and have technical skills then we're keen to hear from you, but we also open to candidates with all levels of experience. This role would be ideally suited to Computer Science graduates with customer-facing experience, who are looking to start their careers at an exciting scale-up.
You will need to:
Truly want to keep our customers happy even under pressure.
Demonstrate proficiency in understanding our clients' business processes.
Possess prior experience in customer-facing roles.
Exhibit comfort with web applications, CRMs, or similar web-based software requiring configuration and management.
Showcase troubleshooting prowess and a passion for problem-solving.
Be eager to delve into understanding the technical side of our product and how our customers utilise it.
Be a team-player but able to work on your own too
Happy to work outside the regular 9-5 to cover our global clients
As our clientele predominantly operates in the UK or utilises English as their working language, excellent English proficiency is a prerequisite.

1477909.title: Secondary System Designer
1477909.description:
Are you passionate about electrical design and eager to work on large-scale international projects? We are looking for a skilled secondary systems designer to join our team, specializing in medium and high voltage substations, control circuit, and auxiliary design. The project are mostly located in Finland and Baltics, but sometimes in other countries.
Your Profile:
Degree in Electrical Engineering or Electrical Technician qualification.
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in electrical design and engineering.
Proficiency in design software (e.g., Eplan) and Microsoft Office.
Fluency in written and spoken English; (Finnish or Estonian language skills are an asset).
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
Strong ownership and the attention to details and accuracy.
Good communication skills and cultural awareness.
Willingness to travel occasionally and visit project sites.
Valid driving license.

Key Responsibilities::
Design and engineer relay protection, control circuits, and auxiliary systems for medium and high voltage substations.
Prepare and review technical documentation, drawings, and schematics.
Collaborate with project teams to ensure designs meet project requirements and timelines.
Communicate effectively with customers, colleagues, and stakeholders from diverse backgrounds.
Ensure compliance with industry standards and safety regulations.

What We Offer::
Competitive salary with additional performance-based bonuses.
Flexible working arrangements (office/home).
Additional paid vocation days
Additional health insurance
Sport compensation
Opportunity to work on large-scale international projects.
Long-term career development and the chance to become an expert in your field.
Support for expanding your technical knowledge, including training opportunities.
Supportive colleagues with good team spirit.

1478563.title: Customer Support Manager
1478563.description:
About the job:
We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Customer Support Manager to lead and transform our customer service operations. At Stebby, we are all about proactive problem-solving and adding real value to our users lives. The ideal candidate is passionate about fostering a happy, high-performing team, defining and upholding exceptional service standards with consistency, and collaborating cross-functionally to drive customer satisfaction and retention.
Location:
Tallinn or Tartu based.

What you will do:
Lead and develop the Customer Support team - plan and organize the team's work, conduct 1-on-1s, performance reviews, daily calls and team meetings.
Ensure service quality and meet customer satisfaction expectations by implementing and establishing new best practices and customer service standards.
Own the metrics - drive decision-making by utilizing data to transform service trends into actionable product and process improvements.
Drive cross-team collaboration with Sales and Product teams to resolve systemic issues and align customer retention strategies.
Design and deliver training to reduce customer turnover and capture additional business opportunities; empower the team to continuously learn and develop their skills.
Advance coaching culture and be an active mentor for the team.
Align and collaborate with other teams to meet company goals.

What we are looking for:
At least 5 years of managerial and customer support experience.
Good understanding of modern solutions and operations related to customer service.
Ability to interpret data to make business cases.
A people person and a team player.
Experience with cross-team collaboration with business and technical teams.
A strong sense of ownership, the ability to work independently and a decent work ethic.
Ability to effectively lead a hybrid/remote team.
Excellent Estonian and English skills. Proficiency in Russian is considered an advantage.

Our promises to you:
A chance to make a change in peoples habits to live a healthier life - more wellness equals better health and a happier society.
Family-friendly benefits to support work-life balance (hybrid workplace, health insurance, dedicated monthly budget for your health & wellness, days-off for personal occasions, extra vacation days, to name a few).
Personal training budget to support your professional and personal growth.
Opportunity to work with a positive, active and committed team.
Fun and modern environment combined with the perks of a fully established and still expanding company.

1480107.title: Senior Facilities Manager
1480107.description:
Join our team as a Senior Facilities Manager!
Yes, you can! That's our attitude towards our work, ambitions, ideas, and relationships. We at Luminor believe that anyone has the potential to achieve big things and encourage everyone to achieve them, professionally and personally.
Whoever you are and whatever your role is, with Luminor, you will get a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to build a local banking champion.
Your mission is to lead the seamless operation of our facilities, delivering a secure and high-quality environment for employees and customers.
How You Will Make an Impact:
Own facilities-related processes and contracts (rent, maintenance, etc. other services)
Provide employees with a contemporary and high quality working environment, initiating necessary improvement projects
Shape a long-term strategic view for the premises
Execute security and safety processes
Own workplace management process and transportation services technical part
Cooperate with other units for development and execution of processes (People & Culture, Op Risk, accounting, legal etc.)
Oversee fixed assets of the bank, keeping inventory of the assets
Organize training to bank employees in matters relating to facilities
Cooperate with suppliers
What Makes You a Great Fit:
Deep understanding of Facilities management and previous 5 year experience in a similar profession, that includes overseeing and owning questions and improvements that relate to physical security
Excellent communication skills and ability to act as advisor for stakeholders
Ability to read technical drawings
Knowledge of health & safety regulations
Ability to manage construction and development projects
Ability to write internal procedures in area of expertise
Fluent English and Estonian is required in spoken and written communication due to working on the Pan-Baltic level
Why You Will Love Working Here:
Flexibility.
Flexible working hours, Hybrid work, and the possibility to work from anywhere in the EU, Iceland, Switzerland, and the UK (in total 90 days per year)
International teams.
Teams that go outside Pan-Baltic borders, where people value challenging work together with good humor and having fun
Culture.
You’ll be joining a team where things move fast, ideas flow freely, and change is part of the everyday. It’s a dynamic environment that keeps you learning, growing, and never bored
More vacation.
Additional weeks of vacation are available to all employees who have been in the company for 1 year or more
Volunteer time off.
We care about giving back to society, therefore, you will get additional days off for volunteering purposes
Paid leave.
We are proud of our employees who are participating in military training. Therefore, Luminor offers 30 fully paid calendar days for military training every year
Health benefits.
A competitive benefits package in addition to your salary that includes health insurance after the first 3 months pass in all three Baltic states, as well as Health days in case of your absence due to sickness without a doctor's note needed
Wellbeing.
Access to tools and resources that help you feel good and be productive at work and in life
Professional growth.
Internal and external training programs, LinkedIn learning, workshops, conferences, online training, etc
Special Offer for Luminor products & services.
Enjoy special offers & pricing for products and services provided by Luminor
Gross salary.
2,400 - 3,700 EUR/month, which is to be determined depending on your level of experience and competencies
The application deadline is the 31st of December.
We are looking for a candidate primarily already located within the Baltics. Please apply with your CV in English and
PDF format
!

1480237.title: Atlassian Administrator
1480237.description:
A bit about us:
By bringing together next-gen technology and the finest live data available, Genius Sports is enabling a new era of sports for fans worldwide, delivering experiences that are more immersive, interactive and personalised than ever before. Learn more at geniussports.com.
THE ROLE:
Genius Sports is a longstanding user of the Atlassian tooling. Like most companies, we have accrued some overlap in our internal tooling and we’re looking to streamline this across teams by importing data and migrating teams over to the Atlassian stack. Genius Sports is looking for a passionate Atlassian administrator to help us with achieving our goal of driving adoption of Jira and Confluence further within the business so we can end up with a unified stack for documentation and work management.

What you'll do:
Monitor responsible usage of the Jira & Confluence systems and maintain configuration and workflows
Monitor upcoming changes and feature releases for tools in scope
Support adoption of Atlassian tooling when migration is being done
Work with the IT team on reviewing requests or suggestions, assess their impact and value, and prioritise appropriately
Understand usage and plan migrations between ITSM and documentation tooling
Write scripts and API calls as needed to automate migration processes
In conjunction with the IT and business teams, plan appropriate migration paths to ensure usability and feature parity
Script API calls to facilitate the migration into from Jira and Confluence from other tooling - Notion, Linear, other Jira instances

What you'll bring:
Work experience in a similar position where maintenance of Atlassian tooling and migration to Atlassian tools was required
Extensive Atlassian experience - Jira and Confluence and their respective API’s
Experience in migrating/merging Jira instances and migrating data into Jira and Confluence cloud
Understanding of the agile workflow and requirements
Understanding of permissions structure in Atlassian tooling
Ability to quickly learn and adapt
Solid verbal and written communication skills (English), including the ability to communicate complex issues to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Why join?:
We enjoy an office-first culture and maximize opportunities to collaborate, connect and learn together. Our hybrid working models differ depending on your role and location.
As well as a competitive salary and range of benefits, were committed to supporting employee wellbeing and helping you grow your skills, experience and career. Learn more about how rewarding life at Genius can be at Reward | Genius Sports.
One team, being brave, driving change
We strive to create an
inclusive working environment, where everyone feels a sense of belonging and
the ability to make a difference. Learn more about our values and culture at Culture | Genius
.
Let us know when you apply if you need any assistance during the recruiting process due to a disability.

Riigivara projektijuhi-koordinaatori peamiseks rolliks on ette valmistada ja menetleda tsiviiltoetuse ressursside tagamisega ja riigivaraga seotud toiminguid (sh haldustoiminguid). Koordineerida ja arendada tsiviiltoetuse ressursside tagamisega seotud valdkonda ja valdkonnaga seotud meeskonda. Tsiviiltoetuse registri arendusprotsessides osalemine.
